Doña María con  el préstamo espera tener más producto que ofrecer para  poder cubrir la demanda  de los  clientes que  recibe ya que  esta su negocio en una  zona  muy  comercial. Y con los ingresos obtenidos espera mejorar un poco su situación económica y la de su familia.
Doña María en el futuro espera que su negocio sea  el comedor  más  grande de la  aduana. Gracias a la inversión hecha en el mismo y sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades  para la  sociedad



Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto del  2013
texts.en:
Sra. María is a responsible, honest, and hardworking person.  She lives with her husband and three children in southern Honduras.  Her business involves selling food.  

Doña María is requesting a loan because she needs to buy chicken, beef, soft drinks, rice, beans, tortillas, bananas, potatoes, cassava, condiments, and other items.  By having a sufficient inventory of products, she can continue preparing the dishes that she sells.  With this loan, Doña María hopes to have enough products to satisfy the demand from her customers since her business is located in a commercial area.  

With the profit she earns, María hopes to slightly improve the financial situation for herself and her family.  In the future, she hopes that her business will become the largest diner in the duty-free zone.  Thanks to the investment she has made, she hopes that her children will become good people and that society will offer them better opportunities.  

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, soft drinks, rice, beans, tortillas, bananas, potatoes, cassava, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Reyma

texts.en:
Reyma is 52 years old and married, with five children. 

Reyma is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her flock.

Reyma has been raising ducks for 10 years now.   She has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

In the future, Reyma would like to save money to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Dora Abelina

texts.es:
Dora de 63 años de edad, tiene un grado de estudio de segundo año de educación básica, esta acompañada, su compañero de vida no trabaja por motivos de salud. Además, de ellos viven con ellos un sobrino,  quien le ayuda a ella con la venta que realiza diariamente.

Ella se dedica a la venta de atol y poliada.  Madruga para hacer el atol y salir a vender, y hace poliada por las tardes ella se queda vendiendo cerca de su casa. También, se dedica a la venta de arreglos florales para día de muertos y a la venta de pólvora para la temporada navideña, tiene mas de 35 años de experiencia en el negocio, ya que manifiesta que fue la actividad que a realizado para sacar adelante a sus hijos.      

El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de flores, oasis para los arreglos florales. Con el préstamo, pretende ampliar su margen de ganancia con respecto a lo invertido el año anterior, de las ganancias ella piensa invertir una parte de ellas para al compra de pólvora, por motivo que se acerca la temporada navideña.
La señora planifica seguir creciendo con su negocio y que en un futuro su sobrino se haga cargo del negocio.
texts.en:
63-year old Dora has studied up to second year of basic education. She is married but her husband has health problems and cannot work. A nephew lives with them and helps Dora with daily sales.

She earns her living selling atol (a cornflour-based drink) and poleada (thick milk-based drink). She makes the atol in the morning and then leaves the house to sell it. In the afternoons she makes the poleada and remains near the house to sell it. As well, Dora sells flower arrangements for the Day of the Dead, and fireworks at Christmas time. She has more than 35 years business experience, which has helped her and her family get ahead. 

Dora will use the loan money to buy flowers and oasis for the arrangements. She will try to earn more money than she did last year. She is planning to invest part of the profits in the purchase of more fireworks as Christmas is approaching. She wants to continue expanding the business so that in the future her nephew can take over.

loans.use: buy flowers and oasis for flower arrangements

loans.name: Maria Reyna

texts.es:
Doña María Reyna es una mujer de 38 años de edad una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante que junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura con el cual procreo 4 hijos de los cuales los 2 mayores apoyan a sus padres con las diferentes actividades que se realizan en el campo trabajando fuertemente para que sus 2 hermanos terminen la escuela. Doña María Reyna aprendió este oficio desde que era muy pequeña siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra ya que ellos son agricultores por generaciones. Sus cultivos lo tienen ubicado en una comunidad cercana la cual está ubicada a unos 35 minutos aproximadamente de camino. Doña María Reyna tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta cuarto grado y trabaja fuertemente para educar sus 2 hijos menores para que ellos puedan estar mejor y con mayores oportunidades de esa manera ella podrá tener esperanzas para cuando ella y su esposo envejezcan tener un apoyo por parte de todos sus hijo.

Sus sueños y planes a futuro como madre es ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones de vida, con mejores oportunidades de empleo y con una tierra donde vivir y trabajar. Para su negocio poder sembrar una mayor cantidad y variedad de producto para de esa manera fortalecer sus tierras y fortalecer la economía en su hogar. Por los que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual ella pueda inyectar capital a sus cultivos protegiéndolos con los diferentes insumos que comprara como abono, fertilizantes, fungicidas entre otros que harán de la temporada una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
María Reyna, 38, is an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.   She and her husband work in agriculture.  They have four children.  The two older ones help their parents with the various field chores working hard so that their two siblings can complete their schooling.

María Reyna learned this occupation when still very young since her parents taught her how to work the land since they’ve been farmers for generations.  Her crops are located in a nearby community located about 35 minutes away.  María Reyna did not complete elementary school; she only got up to fourth grade but she works hard to school her two younger children so that they can be better and with better opportunities.  In this way, she hopes that for when she and her husband are old-aged they’ll get support from all their children.

Her future dreams and plans as a mother are to see her children living under better conditions with better employment opportunities and with land to live on and to work.  For her business, they are to plant larger amounts and varieties of products to strengthen the soil and her home’s economy.  

This is why today she’s asking for a loan to inject capital into her crops protecting them with the various supplies like manure, fertilizer, fungicide, etc.,  she’ll buy that will lead to a good harvest season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Batjargal lives with his wife and daughter in a Mongolian traditional ger (a portable felt dwelling) on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital of Mongolia. The family income consists of his taxi service income and his wife's teaching salary. 

The borrower wants to build his dream house before winter.  He has used his previous loans for buying specific building materials such as planks, cement, bricks, and fiberglass. Now he is requesting a loan of MNT 3,000,000 to buy vacuum-insulated windows and hardwood floors.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum-insulated windows and hardwood floors

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 14 years. She sells  variety of items such as canned goods, rice, soap and other miscellaneous items. 

Argie is requesting a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Argie would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vilma Yuami

texts.es:
Doña Vilma es una mujer de 32 años de edad una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante que junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura con el cual tiene un hijo el cual tiene 3 años de edad viviendo en casa solo ellos tres. Doña Vilma aprendió este oficio desde que era muy pequeña siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra ya que ellos son agricultores por generaciones. Sus cultivos de maíz y hortalizas están ubicados en su misma propiedad por lo que esto ayuda y permite a dar un mejor mantenimiento y asistencia para que estén sanos y libres de plagas. Doña Vilma tiene un grado de educación primaria completado el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo brindado por sus padres. Por lo que diariamente trabaja fuertemente para ahorrar y asegurar el futuro de su hijo para que el no pase por la misma situación que ella en su juventud.

Sus sueños y planes a futuro como madre es ver a su hijo en mejores condiciones de vida, con mejores oportunidades de empleo y con una tierra donde vivir y trabajar. Para su negocio poder sembrar una mayor cantidad y variedad de producto para de esa manera fortalecer sus tierras y fortalecer la economía en su hogar. Por los que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual ella pueda inyectar capital a sus cultivos protegiéndolos con los diferentes insumos que comprara como abono, fertilizantes, fungicidas entre otros que harán de la temporada una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Vilma, 32, is an enterprising woman with a strong desire to get ahead.  She and her husband work in agriculture and have a 3-year-old son; the three of them live alone in their house.  

Vilma learned her occupation when she was little since her parents taught her to work the land; they’ve been farmers for generations.  Her corn and vegetables crops are located on her same property which is a help to her and allows her to provide better care and maintenance so that they will stay free of pests and be healthy.  Vilma completed elementary school which she was able to complete thanks to the support provided by her parents.  She works hard every day to save in order to insure her son’s future so that he won’t go through the same situation she did in her youth.

Her future dreams and plans as a mother are to see her son in better conditions than hers with better employment opportunities and with land to work and to live on.   For her business, they are to be able to plant larger variety and amount of product to strengthen the soil and her family economy.

She’s asking for a loan today to inject capital into her crops protecting them with the various supplies like manure, fertilizer and fungicide, among others that will lead to a good harvest season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 63 years old, married, and has five children. She is from Carmen Annex. She runs a general store, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Rosita is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks to sell.  She has repaid her previous loans in a timely fashion. She hopes to open more store outlets soon.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 58, resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Juanito, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elvira operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Elvira dreams that one day her store will become a grocery store and hopes to have her house renovated.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: José Ricardo

texts.es:
Don José de 58 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado educativo, es viudo. Conviven con una nuera y 4 nietos, los cuales están estudiando y su nuera realiza los quehaceres del hogar. 

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 40 años, por su propia cuenta. Anteriormente, lo hacia con su padre de quien aprendió el oficio. Viaja un kilómetro a pie hasta donde tiene el cultivo de maíz,también cuida unos cañales que están cerca de su vivienda  .

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde va cultivar,comprara abono semilla, pesticidas para su cultivo. Para adquirir los insumos agrícolas,viajara en un bus hasta la ciudad.

 Gracias al crédito tendrá mas ingresos para su familia y poder cancelar su crédito y con las ganancias seguir construyendo su nueva vivienda,  mejorar su cultivos. Para todo esto, sabe que podrá lograrlo, solamente si continua trabajando fuertemente, como hasta hoy lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
José is 58 years old, has had no education and is a widower. He lives with a daughter-in-law and 4 grandchildren, who are studying. His daughter-in-law does the household tasks.

José has been working in agriculture for 40 years and is self-employed. Previously he worked with his father from whom he learnt his skills. He walks a kilometre to where he grows his corn and he also looks after some water channels near to his house.

The loan he is asking for is to pay the rent of the land where he goes to grow his crops and to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for his crops. He travels by bus to the city to buy his agricultural supplies.

Thanks to the loan he will have more income for his family and will be able to pay off his loan. With the profits he will be able to continue building his new home and improve his crops. He knows that he will only be able to achieve all of this if he keeps working hard, as he has done up until now.

loans.use: to pay the rent of the land where he goes to grow his crops and to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to clear his land.

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn, a 46-year-old married mother of three, has been earning a living  raising pigs in the Philippines for 11 years. She makes additional income from farming vegetables and selling ready-to-wear clothing.


Geralyn is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en: Mr. Batjargal, 36 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a monitoring engineer at building company for two years. His wife has been decorating house interior components and works on contract with building companies or individuals. The house his family lives in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair. So, he is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about the upcoming winter. Also, they will burn less coal for heating and fewer pollutants will be released into the atmosphere. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Teratai Indah Group

texts.en:
Sayu Komang lives in the city of Negara in west Bali. She helps her husband provide income by running a pig business at her home. Besides being a pig breeder she also has a small kiosk.

In order to expand her business, Sayu Komang is raising capital by joining the group, Teratai Indah, where she was chosen by other members as the head of the group. They work together with MUK to get business loans for pig farmers.

With the loan of 18,000,000 IDR for the group, Sayu Komang receives 2,000,000 IDR. She is planning to buy 3 piglets with a price of 500,000 IDR each and also feed for them. Although feed is currently very expensive, she expects the sale of the 3 pigs later will gain a satisfactory profit and can increase the income of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 3 superior piglets and feed for them.

loans.name: Bilguun

texts.en: Mr. Bilguun is a student who studies in the local private university. He is really passionate for science, especially medical science. This is the reason why he chose this profession. Bilguun is the only child of the family and a very hardworking student. This loan will help him to continue to study and graduate successfully.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
This is Shirley. She previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Shirley hopes that her business will get stronger and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед 40 лет. Он женат и воспитывает прекрасных детей. Хуршед имеет высшее образование и работает в государственном учреждении. Хуршед старается, чтобы его дети получили высшее образование и стали высококвалифицированными специалистами. Его дочь Манзура в этом году окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса по специальности Международное Отношение. Хуршед должен оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери , но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Kurshed is 40, married, and is raising wonderful children. He has a college degree and works in a government institute. Kurshed is trying to ensure that his children receive a college education and become highly qualified specialists. His daughter Manzura graduated from high school this past year and was accepted at the State University of Politics and Business with a major in International Relations. Kurshed needs to pay for his daughter's tuition, but cannot afford it. He is requesting a loan to pay for the tuition. He awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's college tution

loans.name: Belinda

texts.es:
Doña Belinda tiene 31 años de edad una mujer muy luchadora y con muchos sueños e ideales en la vida, ella es madre de 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad viviendo en su casa de habitación su esposo, ella y sus 2 hijos. Ella cuanta con la primaria completa gracias al apoyo de sus padres a pesar de las diferentes adversidades y dificultades que pasaran en esos tiempos para poder educarla a nivel escolar. Ella se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de papa desde hace muchos años ya que en su juventud no solo la educaron con principio y valores sino también a ver el valor del trabajo siendo sus padres agricultores fueron ellos quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 20 metros de su casa de habitación a los cuales se trasladan a pie en compañía de su esposo siendo ellos 2 los únicos involucrados.

Sus metas y sus sueños es forjar un patrimonio fuerte, sólido para el bienestar de su hijo y los venideros para que tengan donde trabajar, donde construir sus hogares y poder generar ingresos para sus familias. Por lo que hoy en día está solicitando un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos como, foliares, abono, fertilizantes, semilla certificada de papa entre otros para poder asistir y sembrar nuevos cultivos.
texts.en:
Belinda, 31, is a very hardworking woman with many life dreams and ideals.  She’s mother of two children who are minors living with her and her husband in a house of their own.  She completed primary school thanks to her parents’ support despite the various difficulties and adversities they went through back then to be able to provide schooling for her.

She has worked for many years growing potatoes since in her youth her parents didn’t just teach her principles and values but also taught her the value of work.  Since her parents worked in agriculture what they taught her was how to work the land.  Her crops are located 20 meters from her house so she reaches them on foot.  She and her husband work together and do the work by themselves.

Her goals and dreams are to forge a solid estate for her children’s well-being and her future children too so that they will have a place to work, to build their homes and to be able to generate income for their families.

This is why she’s asking for a loan today to buy supplies like leaf fertilizer, manure, fertilizer and certified potato seed, among others to maintain and plant new crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 53 years old, married, with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Delia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Delia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 51 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. In the future Julie would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is 42 years old and married with one kid who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for fourteen years. 

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Angelie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Batjargal, 50 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He has been running a transportation business by renting two trucks to individuals for over fourteen years. 

The house the family lives in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs some serious repair. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, planks, cement and fiberglass. 

After repair, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing fewer pollutants into the atmosphere. Batjargal is a very hardworking individual who, before renting trucks, transported goods between cities.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en: Mr. Batchuluun, 30 years old, lives with his pregnant wife in an old house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people for two years and accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up passengers, driving quickly, and shortening routes. He is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase vacuum-insulated windows and fiberglass. Installing vacuum windows will stop the heat loss through windows and insulating walls with fiberglass will protect the house from storms and frost. The renovated house will enable the couple to burn less coal for heating thus releasing less pollutants into atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum-insulated windows and fiberglass

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
This is Salve, 37, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She’s married to Solomon, a messenger, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Salve is a rice dealer. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the sack or by the kilo. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also sells frozen foods, fruits and vegetables. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of rice for her business.

Salve hopes that her business will expand and dreams that her children will finish their studies and have good jobs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more sacks of rice for her business.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина родилась в 1986 года. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. Она живет вместе с родителями. Мадина окончила среднюю школу в 2004 году и начала свой бизнес. Мадина прошла курс по подготовке профессиональных парикмахеров и получила сертификат. Она несколько лет работала в салоне. Она арендовала помещение. Мадина имеет много клиентов и поэтому последнее время она работает дома. Мадина хочет пополнить свой оборотный капитал, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки краски, фен, зеркало, искусственные волосы и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Madina is 27, single, and has no children. She lives with her parents. SHe graduated form high school in 2004, and started her own business. She took a course in hairdressing and received a graduate certificate. She has worked for several years in her hair salon, for which she leased office space. Madina has many clients and, consequently, has been working out of her home recently. She wants to bolster her working capital, but does not have enough money. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni for buying cosmetics, a hairdryer, a mirror, artificial hair, etc. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy mirror and etc for increasing working capital

loans.name: Asly

texts.ru: Асли умный и интеллигентный молодой человек. Ему 21 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями и сестрой. Он окончил университет и уже год как он работает в государственном учреждении. Асли работает как ведущий специалист. Асли имеет хорошие знания, и поэтому он быстро развевается по работе. Он помогает родителям по обеспечению семьи. Его сестра скоро выходит замуж и необходимо провести ее свадебное торжество. Однако ее родители не имеют денег. Асли хочет помочь своим родителям, чтобы провести свадебное торжество сестры. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Asly is a smart and intelligent young man.  He is 21 years old.  He is not married and lives with his parents and sister.  He graduated from a university and has been working at a government office for one year.  Asly works as a leading specialist.  Asly has good knowledge and this is why he grows fast at work.  He helps his parents with supporting the family.  His sister is getting married soon, and it is necessary to hold her wedding.  However, her parents do not have money.  Asly wants to help his parents in order to hold the wedding celebration for his sister.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni to hold the wedding celebration.  He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to hold the wedding celebration for his sister

loans.name: Zanjiramo

texts.ru: Занчирамо женщина с открытой душой. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Обеспечение 5 детей требует много благ, поэтому Занчирамо и ее муж стараются работать упорно и получать больше дохода. Ее муж имеет свой ресторан-вагон. Занчирамо занимается купле продажей продуктов питания. Она имеет более чем 20 лет опыта в бизнесе. Она трудолюбивая женщина и поэтому с бизнесом справляется отлично. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Она хочет пополнить оборотный капитал. С такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zanjiramo is a woman with an open soul.  She is married and has five children.  Providing for five children requires a lot of resources and this is why Zanjiramo and her husband try to work hard and earn more money.  Her husband owns a restaurant-truck.  Zanjiramo is involved in buying and selling food products.  She has over 20 years of experience in this business.  She is a hardworking woman and this is why she handles the business excellently.  Her husband helps her with running the business.  She wants to refill her working capital and requested a loan with this goal in mind.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 US dollars to refill her working capital.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food to refill her working capital

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is a widowed businesswoman from Ozamiz City. She has 3 children and has a snack vending business to support her family. She has been a member of PMPC since 2007 and has the privilege of requesting a loan to finance her business. She requested the amount of Php 32,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. She wants to open more outlets for more sales.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Mialina

texts.en:
Mialina has run an eatery business for six years already. She is married and is a mother to her six children. She enjoys her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and has availed herself of the various programs and services of PMPC. 

Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her eatery business. She wants to expand her eatery to include catering and accepting bulk orders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her eatery business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

She has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming vegetables and selling ready-to-wear clothing. Jocelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Levy William

texts.es:
Levy hombre de 36 años, solo tubo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta 6º grado, esta casado; su esposa es agricultora, tienen 4 hijos (17, 14, 10 y  9 años de edad), de los cuales 2 están en la escuela. 

Don Levy, ha sido jornalero toda su vida y de ser agricultor y trabajar en lo propio 8 años. La forma en que aprendió, fue gracias a un amigo que tenia milpas, y le decía que le ayudara a sembrar, fertilizar, tapiscar y doblar. Así fue como, tubo conocimiento y decidió trabajar en lo propio. Su esposa, le ayuda junto con sus hijos, y para llegar a donde esta la siembra, se suben en sus caballos, porque esta a una distancia de aproximadamente 3 km de su casa, y trabajan de 6.30 de la mañana a 1 de la tarde.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar los fertilizantes, herbicidas y pagar la maquinaria agrícola. Para la producción de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. 

Lo que mas desea, es superarse y ser exitoso. Todo esto lo lograra, con los otorgamientos de los créditos. Los cuales no solo le ayudaran a él, sino que también se verán beneficiados los miembros de su familia. Todo esto servirá para mejorarles la calidad de vida a todas estas personas, y lo hará sentir feliz.
texts.en:
Levy, 36, was only able to complete 6th grade.  He’s married and his wife works in agriculture.  They have four children (17, 14, 10 and 9 years of age).  Two of them attend school.

Levy has been a day laborer his entire life and has been working in agriculture for himself for 8 years.  He learned from a friend who owned corn fields and told him that he’d help him plant, fertilize, remove husks and fold.  This is how he gained knowledge and decided to start working for himself.  His wife and children help him and they reach their fields on horseback because they are located about 3 kilometers from home.  They work from 6:30 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for a tractor to produce 7,000 square meters of corn.

What he most wants is to improve and be successful.  He will attain this with loans granted that will not only help him but also all the members of his family.  All of this will serve to improve the quality of life of all these people and that will make him happy.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to weed the grove and pay coffee pickers.

loans.name: Hannah Lorraine

texts.en:
Hannah Lorraine works hard to support child. Married and the operator of a food-vending business in the Philippines, she has requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp to have as a backup light in case of emergency.

Hannah Lorraine is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Precilla Group

texts.en:
Chinzanian is the featured borrower for Precilla Lom group and she is presented with her hand raised. She is known for her confidence and endeavour in whatever she ventures. Their group formation has completed more than two years and they still believe in one another. The group wish to continue their relationship for better or for worse. They all live in a town which is about 62 kms away from the town capital and it is also the second most populated town in the state of Manipur, which is one of the North-Eastern states in India.

Chinzanian runs a tea-stall in the village, and the stall is located at the junction point of three villages. Villagers, nearby residents and passengers waiting for public transport usually stop at the tea-stall for tea, 'puri', toast, boiled egg, and omelette. Her love for work is appreciated by the group members as well as by villagers. Household expenses are borne by her as her husband's income is mainly used for their children's education and other family expenses. She is always in need of capital money as family priorities need to be taken care of and borrowing money from money lenders is possible only at a high rate of interest.

With her Kiva loan, Chinzanian will purchase stock like wheat flour, milk powder, and liquified petroleum gas. She wants to run the business efficiently and generate more income to manage her family expenses. She thanked Kiva and WSDS for the wonderful work shown with the group and she wishes to continue working under the umbrella of Kiva and WSDS. She says, “Thank you so much, Kiva.”

The rest of the group members are also engaged in small businesses like selling chilli, 'paan-dukan' and running a variety shop.

loans.use: To purchase stock like wheat flour and powdered milk for the tea-shop

loans.name: Diomema

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Diomema works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Diomema is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Melati Putih Group

texts.en:
After calculating and evaluating the last period, the Melati Putih group decided to continue their loan. The loans are used for increasing their pig businesses by purchasing new piglets and/or quality feed. The group received the same loan amount, each of them getting 1,500,000 IDR.

Kadek will use her loan to purchase 3 super quality piglets for fattening. With her own money, she purchased feed and renovated the pig cages. She plans to sell the pigs near the holiday to get a good price. She hopes her plan will run well. She and the group still need advice and loan support for their businesses until they are ready and have enough capital to continue the businesses by themselves.

loans.use: To purchase 3 super quality piglets.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is 58 years old and happily married to Antonio, who works as a farmer. She is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. God has blessed Priscila and her husband with loving children. Life indeed is hard but by the grace of God, they have been able to raise their children well and they help each other work for their family. Priscila owns a variety store, which is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community. Generally, stores are connected to, or inside, people’s houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, 5-PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Priscila buys her products from a wholesaler and sells them by the piece at a higher price to earn a profit. Her regular customers are neighbors, passersby, and people in her community. Priscila earns 300 PHP each day. 

Priscila is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. Her loan will be a great help to add more products to her store. Priscila hopes that her business will expand and she dreams of always being in good health. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from fellowship and studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and to do weeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady est une vieille femme très brave qui est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans la vente de Draps, tissus et pagnes tissées. Elle a une expérience de 10ans dans cette activité. Elle sollicite ce crédit d’un montant de 50 000 F pour augmenter son fond de commerce en achetant des draps et pagnes tissés pour ensuite les revendre à ses clients potentiels dans le marché de la commune. Ses charges principales sont les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Khady  souhaite à l’avenir ouvrir un magasin pour augmenter ses revenus et bâtir sa maison afin de pouvoir mettre ses enfants dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: Mrs. Khady is a courageous older woman, 53 years of age. She is married and has children. She works a s a vendor of linens, cloth and traditional woven “pagnes” fabric. She has more than 10 years of experience in this business. She is seeking this loan in the amount of 50,000 West African francs  to bolster her business capital by stocking up on linens and woven “pagnes” to resell at her community market. Her main costs are the everyday expenses of her family. In the future, she would like to open a warehouse in order to increase her revenue and to build a house in order to be able to improve the life conditions of her children.

loans.use: to buy linens and traditional fabric for resale.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 49 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. For the past ten years, she has run a fishing business in the Philippines. Amelita is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Amelita is requesting a 24,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Amarsaikhan

texts.en:
Amarsaikhan is 48 years old and lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. For 23 years, Amarsaikhan has been a serviceman at a high school. His wife is a sentry at a private business entity. Over the years, their house has deteriorated and it currently needs some serious repair. 

Amarsaikhan is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam. After this renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place and will burn less coal for heating. This reduction in coal usage will have a positive impact on environment as fewer pollutants will be released into atmosphere. Amarsaikhan is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Khieng

texts.en:
Khieng, age 41, is married and has four children living at home in a small house in the Kien Svay district, Kandal province. 

She and her husband are farmers and also health workers. She learned her business after she graduated from high school and met her husband. Three of her children are in school, but take time to help with household chores and farming activities when they don’t have any schedules at school. 

With the loan Khieng has requested from HKL, she will build a latrine and a water storage tank, made of clay bricks and cement, to supply enough water for her household.  The water supply of the state does not cover her area yet. 

Through the loan support, she will be able to provide her family with a comfortable living. She is very happy and thankful, because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rate. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a latrine and a water storage tank, made of clay bricks and cement, to supply water for her household.

loans.name: Ma. Lani

texts.en:
Ma. Lani is the married mother of seven children. She works selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Lani works hard to support her family and has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF.

Ma. Lani is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Melvin Eli

texts.es:
Melvin de 36 años de edad, solo ha estudiado hasta 3er año de bachillerato, está casado y es padre de dos hijos (una niña de 15 y un niño de 14 años) que actualmente viven con ellos y que está estudiando en una escuela pública.

Es empleado de la alcaldía municipal, desde hace unos 6 meses, presta servicios de seguridad pública en una unidad. Antes, estaba prestado sus servicios en una cadena de supermercados. Por todo, posee una experiencia de 15 años desempeñando esta actividad de servicios de seguridad pública. La aprendió de un hermano, que es también agente de seguridad.

 La distancia que recorre para, llegar a su lugar de trabajo, es aproximadamente 2 kilómetros desde su casa de habitación hasta la alcaldía, también cuanta con el apoyo de su esposa que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales de gallina. El servicio de seguridad en la alcaldía lo realiza en diferentes horarios de trabajo siendo estos de 6: am a 12 m y de 1:00 pm hasta las 4 de la tarde y en hora de la noche de 6:00 hasta 10:00 pm.  

El financiamiento será invertido, en la compra de una motocicleta que utilizara para el traslado desde su casa hasta el lugar de trabajo. Con la compra de la motocicleta se podrá movilizar más rápido y también manifestó que sus padres viven lejos y ellos ya está mayores y los visita muy a menudo. 

Los sueños que tiene para su familia, es seguir con la construcción de su vivienda, con la elaboración de  unas habitaciones más.
texts.en:
Melvin, 36, only completed third year of high-school.  He’s married and father of two children (a 15-years-old girl and 14-year-old boy).  They live with him and are attending public school.

He’s worked for the city for about six months providing public safety in a unit.  He used to provide his services to a supermarket chain.  Added all up, he has 15 years’ experience providing public safety services.  He learned from a brother who is also a security agent.

The distance he covers to reach his place of work is about 2 kilometers from home to city hall.  His wife helps out making and selling chicken tamales.  His security job with city hall happens on various shifts.  They are 6am to noon and 1pm to 4pm and a night shift of 6-10pm.

The loan will be used to buy a motorcycle that he’ll use to get from home to work.  Buying the motorcycle will allow him to get around more quickly.  He also stated that his parents live far away and they are elderly and he visits them quite often.

His dream for his family is to continue building his house adding more bedrooms to it.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
This is Dante. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy the grocery items needed in his variety store. His loan was also useful for the education of his child. His income from the business assisted their everyday expenses at home. He has had this business for three years now. He and his wife are working to provide for their everyday needs.

He would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan, for he will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Dante is hoping that his business will continue to be successful and his dream is to give his youngest child a good education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week. At these meetings he draws strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 56 years old and has three children. She is a widow from Ozamiz City. Delia works tending her busy sari-sari (variety) store and snack vending business. She earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month. Delia has reached out to PMPC for additional capital for her businesses.

Delia is requesting a loan to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks to sell and to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store. She wants to save for her retirement and for family emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona works hard to support two children. She is married and has a rice farming business in the Philippines.

Rona requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. 

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency and to help her children study at night.

Rona is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to improve their lighting source by acquiring a solar home system.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn is married with two children and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. Her husband earns money from farming, while she operates a retail store in the local community to earn a living. She joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emely has successfully repaid her previous loan that was used as capital in running her store. She has requests a new loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, snacks, and dairy products for addition to her inventory capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to improve their quality of life by acquiring a solar home system.

loans.name: Aguacatal2 Group

texts.en: Evaristo, who is a member of this group, lives in the community of El Aguacatal in the state of Campeche.  He is 47 years old and has inherited the trade of harvesting goods such as corn, beans and a local vegetable called “chigua”.  These last two goods are only harvested once a year, which means he has temporary income.  In the past year he was able to buy a solar system that he charges with old car batteries.  These require charging in the nearest town, which has a great cost for the family.  By acquiring a new solar home system, Evaristo's family will be able to have a better lighting source that only requires a single battery and has two light bulbs.  Also, since Evaristo became a father 9 months ago, he has increasing concerns for a sense of security that only a good lighting source can provide.

loans.use: to improve his family's lighting source by purchasing a clean energy solar home system.

loans.name: Battsengel

texts.en:
Battsengel is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For the past 13 years, he has been transporting goods among districts. In the winter, Battsengel purchases and brings coal from the mine to the city to sell at a reasonable price. When the supply of coal decreases, he provides a taxi service to local people. The house his family lives in has deteriorated over the years and it currently needs some serious repair. 

Battsengel is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, and fiberglass. He will use these materials to repair and insulate his house. This will create a more comfortable and warm place where Battsengel and his family will burn less coal for heating. The reduction in coal burning will mean less air pollution and less emission of smoke.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Kenanga Indah Group

texts.en:
The Kenanga Indah Group is requesting a loan to continue and increase their businesses. All of the group members have decided together to purchase only superior piglets. They chose this option to have the same price and to earn better profit when the pigs are later sold together. 

Ni Komang will use her portion of the loan to purchase three superior piglets. She will combine superior feed with traditional feed. She and her husband are really grateful for their loans as each day she spends 15 USD for their daily needs and 100 USD each month on electricity and water.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз родилась в 1979 года. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Она более 3 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Дилафруз продает мед. Она покупает мед оптом и реализует в розницу. Она обеспечивает себя сама и ей не на кого надеется. Она постепенно год за годом развевает свой бизнес. Благодаря хорошему сервису она привлекает много клиентов. Дилафруз хочет пополнить оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки меда. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Этот займ поможет одинокой женщине, увеличить оборотный капитал и развевать бизнес.
texts.en: Dilafruz was born in 1979.  She is divorced and does not have children.  She has been involved in her own business for over 3 years.  Dilafruz sells honey.  She buys honey wholesale and sells it at retail prices.  She provides for herself and does not rely on anyone.  She gradually, year-after-year develops her business.  Thanks to her good service, she attracts many customers.  Dilafruz wants to refill her working capital.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy honey.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.  This loan will help a single woman to increase her working capital and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy honey and increase her working capital

loans.name: Savsygul

texts.ru: Савсигул женщина с большим жизненным опытом. Она замужем. Савсигул была вынуждена найти источника дохода для содержания своих детей. Савсигул таким образом 2 года назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей детской одежды. Она имеет торговую точку на местном рынке. Савсигул старается обновить свой товар каждый сезон и таким образом привлечь больше клиентов. Ей трудно справляться с семейными расходами, так как она является основной кормилицей семьи. Ее сын хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию, так как он не имеет место работы на родине. Он попросил мать купить ему авиабилет. Савсигул с такой целью обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки авиабилета для сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Savsygul is a woman with a long life experience.  She is married.  Savsygul had to find a source of income to support her children.  Savsygul started her own business in selling children's clothing two years ago.  She has a retail outlet at a local market.  Savsygul tries to update her merchandise every season and thus attract more customers.  It is difficult for her to handle the family expenses because she is the sole provider for her family.  Her son wants to go to the Russian Federation because he does not have a place of work in his native country.  He asked his mother to buy him an airplane ticket.  Savsygul requested this loan for this purpose.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy an airplane ticket for her son.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an airplane ticket for her son

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma resides in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, along with her family. Her husband is a fisherman and she is also engaged in a retail business to earn a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC and recently borrowed a new loan to purchase livestock feed, rice, and dried fish to sell. These two loans with GDMPC, which helps members to improve its ability to engage business, help her to run a business. She is hopeful to have her business and her general living condition improve.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed, rice, and dried fish to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 57 years old and married with three children.

Fe is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fe has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and married with four children.  With all four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a griddle and supplies for making pupusas.

loans.name: La Florida, Campeche Group

texts.en:
Luis Alberto, Isidro, and Manuel are hard-working farmers that make their livings cultivating “chigua”, beans, and corn, which are the predominant agriculture products from the region.  They each live on around 200 USD per month to maintain their families and they lack basic access to infrastructure and services such as water, electricity and concrete households.  

Luis Alberto is one borrower of this group of three who is interested in acquiring a solar home system on credit.  He is 27 years old and lives in the community of Aguacatal, in the state of Campeche, with his wife Elisa and his little three-year-old kid Santos. 

Luis Alberto is a proud farmer - since his childhood his father taught him to love and respect the soil.  Nowadays he harvests maize and beans his family uses for self-consumption and also to sell at the local community market.  Nevertheless, he is able to harvest maize and beans only at autumn and springtime, which is why his wife Elisa started to do handcrafts and sell them in the local market.  These activities allow Luis Alberto to earn an income of about $200 USD per month, money he must distribute to the maintenance of his household and family.  Currently, they rely on hazardous diesel oil lamps to have light during the nighttime, which incurs expenses of around 10% of their monthly income.  Nevertheless, Luis Alberto knows any kind of hard work results in great rewards.  As such, he has made a plan - to buy a solar home system that will allow his little kid to stop breathing the lamp smoke and improve his household conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system in order to stop using diesel oil lamps and improve his household conditions.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Mrs. Bolormaa has been selling casual clothes for nine years, renting a stall at a trade center. She used her previous loan to make renovations on her old house. Now she is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to build an extension on her house. The loan will be used to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. This extension will help preserve heat in the house, thus considerably reducing the burning of coal. Less coal burning means less air pollution.

loans.use: To build an extension on her house

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru: Санобар родилась в 1987 года на северной части Таджикистана. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Санобар более 10 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она шьет национальные одежды для мужчин, как «чапан». Она вначале получала мало дохода. Постепенно год за годом она развевала свой бизнес. Она использует полученный доход для обеспечения семьи. Она хочет развевать свой бизнес и получать больше дохода. С такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки тканей. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Sanobar was born in 1987 in the northern part of Tajikistan.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  Sanobar has been involved in her own business for over 10 years.  She sews national clothing, such as "chapan," for men.  At first, she earned very little.  Gradually, year-after-year, she developed the business.  She uses her income to provide for her family.  She wants to develop her business and earn more money.  She requested a loan for this goal.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7500 somoni to buy fabrics.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sew men clothes

loans.name: Otgonchimeg

texts.en:
Otgonchimeg is a bachelor degree student who studies in a private university. Her chosen major is nursing which has been her dream since she was young. Otgonchimeg lives with two brothers, one sister, and her parents. She is a very hardworking student as well as a good sister for her brothers and sister as she is always taking care of them. 

Otgonchimeg is requesting a loan to pay for her university tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fee

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. She will use this loan to buy gardening materials and other products needed for her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria Theresa hopes that her business will grow stronger and dreams to have a long life with good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 43 years old and married with four children. For the past 14 years, she has earned a living raising chickens in the Philippines. Adela also earns additional income from selling food and raising pigs.

Adela is requesting a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her chickens. She works tirelessly to attain her dream of saving enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her chickens

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is a 55-year-old married woman who runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

Lorelie has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lorelie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Santos Cristina

texts.es:
Santos es una mujer de 53 años de edad, solo ha estudiado hasta el 6to grado, está soltera, cuenta con dos hijas ( 29 y 25 años de edad? ellas ya no viven con ella, ya formaron su propio hogar.  

Ella es empleado del destacamento militar de la ciudad, desde hace 25 años presta servicios como nana haciendo la comida para los soldados, desde hace tiempo ha estado trabajando. Esta actividad la aprendió de su mamá, que también trabajo en el destacamento militar, como nana.  La distancia que recorre para llegar a su trabajo, es aproximadamente 1 kilómetro, en horario de  6:00 a.m a 4 p.m de lunes a sábado.  

El financiamiento será invertido, para comprar una camionada de arena, 5 quitarles de hierro, 50 bolsas de cemento, una camionada de piedras, 500 ladrillos y pago de la mano de obra. Para construir una habitación en su casa, porque en el espacio donde están viviendo es muy pequeño. 

Sus sueños, es seguir con la mejoras en su casa de habitación, cambio de techo, cambio de piso y de puertas. Para sus hijos espera que les quede una casa bien terminada.
texts.en:
Santos, 53, only completed 6th grade.  She’s single and has two daughters (29 and 25 years of age) who no longer live with her and have formed their own homes.

She’s worked for the local military detachment for 25 years as a caregiver preparing the soldiers’ meals; she’s worked for a long time.  She learned this activity from her mother who also worked for the military detachment as a caregiver.  The distance she covers to get to her work is about one kilometer and her schedule is 6am to 4pm Monday to Saturday.

The loan will be used to buy a truckload of sand, five quintals of iron, 50 sacks of cement, one truckload of gravel, 500 bricks and to pay labor costs to add a bedroom to the house because the space they are living in is too small.

Her dream is to continue making home improvements, to replace the roof, replace the floor and doors.  She hopes to complete the house well for her children.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Blanca Edith

texts.es:
Blanca de 34 años de edad, solo estudio noveno grado, su mamá le dijo que era mejor aprender un oficio. y la mando ha estudiar Cosmetología, debido ha eso dejo la escuela. Esta acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la albañilería y estructuras metálicas, tienen tres hijas, están estudiando las dos más grandes 
Se dedica a cuidar a sus hijas, pues tiene una de 8 meses, pero en su hogar hace trabajos de Cosmetología, y así ejerce la profesión que aprendió, antes de acompañarse trabajaba en una pupuseria, pero hoy se dedica a cuidar de su hogar. Su día comienza a las 5:00 .am.. haciendo el desayuno para su familia y luego los oficios del hogar, para estar lista por si llega alguien que desee sus servicios de belleza.
El préstamo, será utilizado una parte para comprar una pulidora y un taladro, que le faltan a su compañero de vida, además, comprara 500 ladrillos,1 quintal de hierro, 15 bolsas de cemento, arena y lamina, con el préstamo será satisfecha la necesidad de construir una habitación  para sus hijas mayores. 
Su sueño, es tener su propio negocio, una sala de belleza para tener mejores ingresos y darles una mejor vida a su familia, además, sueña con ver a sus hijas graduarse en la universidad, ya que ella no pudo
texts.en:
Blanca, 34 years old, studied only through the ninth grade.  Her mother told her it was better to learn a trade and sent her to study cosmetology.  Because of this, she dropped out of school.  

She is in a relationship, and her partner makes his living in construction and metal structures.  They have three daughters, and the older two are studying.  She spends her time caring for her daughters, since she has one who is 8 months old.  But she does cosmetology work from home, and thus practices the profession she learned.  Before she got into this relationship, she used to work in a pupusería (shop selling stuffed tortillas), but now she spends her time taking care of her home.

Her day begins at 5:00 a.m., making breakfast for her family and then tending to household tasks, in order to be ready in case someone arrives who wants her beauty services.

Part of the loan will be used to buy a polishing machine and a drill, which her partner needs.  She will also buy 500 bricks, 1 quintal of iron, 15 bags of cement, sand and metal sheets.  With the loan, she will be able to meet the need of building a room for her older daughters.

Her dream is to have her own business, a beauty salon, in order to have better earnings and to give her family a better life.  She also dreams about seeing her daughters graduate from university, since she was not able to.

loans.use: to buy a polishing machine and a drill, as well as 500 bricks, 1 quintal of iron, 15 bags of cement, sand and metal sheets to build a room for her older daughters.

loans.name: Suvd-Erdene

texts.en: Ms. Suvd-Erdene is bachelor's degree student who studies in the public university. She wanted to be a teacher because she is quite interested in teaching and she teaches well. She lives with her brother, sister, and parents. Suvd-Erdene will be the first person in her family who will graduate from university. If she did not get the loan, she would get a loan with a high interest rate from her friends. The loan use is to pay tuition and dormitory fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and dormitory fees

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old and married with 4 children.  With 4 children in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 39 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos y vive en uniòn libre con su compañero sentimental.  Su vida productiva la ha dedicado a laborar en diferentes empresas alternando con la venta de mercancìa, especialmente artìculos de papelerìa, con el fin de complementar los ingresos familiares. Desde hace 3 años se encuentra desempleada y por falta de oportunidades laborales le ha sido difìcil emplearse, por lo que decidiò retomar nuevamente la venta de mercancìa obteniendo buenos resultados, gracias a ella hace 4 meses montò su negocio propio en un local comercial, allì ofrece productos de detalles y papelerìa en general, de esta manera ha logrado generar ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economìa de su hogar.  La cliente es una mujer luchadora, activa, emprendedora y tiene muchos deseos de seguir progresando; ésto la motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (marcadores, cuadernos, lapiceros, cintas, entre otros), con esto tendrá variedad de productos disponibles para ofrecer a sus clientes, satisfaciendo las diferentes necesidades; esto se reflejará en el incremento de las ventas y por ende los ingresos que recibe. 
Luz sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, acreditarlo, ampliar su portafolio de servicios lo que le permitirá lograr un reconocimiento en el mercado, generando la oportunidad de ofrecer a su familia una estabilidad económica favorable para mejorar las condiciones de vida y brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz, 39, is in a common law relationship with her spouse and mother of three children.  She’s spent her working life employed in various firms selling all kinds of merchandise especially paper goods in order to add to family income.  She’s been unemployed for the last three years and because of the lack of employment opportunities she’s found it hard to get a job which is why she decided to once again start selling merchandise and getting good results.  

Thanks to this she opened a business of her own in a shopping center four months ago.  She sells items like general stationery goods there at retail.  She’s managed thus to earn enough income to contribute to her home’s economy.

She’s a hardworking, enterprising, active woman with a strong wish to continue making progress.  This motivates her to request a loan to buy an assortment of stock merchandise (markers, notebooks, pencils, ribbons, etc.) in order to have a wide variety of goods on-hand to offer customers thus meeting their needs which will then be reflected in higher sales and income earned.

Luz dreams with making her business grow, to make it well-known and to expand her portfolio of services so that she will attain market recognition generating the opportunity of offering her family favorable economic stability to improve living conditions and provide better schooling for her children.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and dormitory fees

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
This is Michael. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy the needed products and supplies for his parlor. His income from the business is helping him with his everyday expenses. He has been in this business for five years now.

He would like to apply for another 23,000 PHP loan to buy products and supplies like hair straightening gel, scissors, shampoo, hair hot oil, etc. His profits from the business will definitely help sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Michael dreams that his business will last longer and hopes to improve the quality of his living. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products like hair straightening gel, scissors, shampoo, hair hot oil, etc.

loans.name: Elia

texts.es:
Elia es una mujer de 65 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, debido que sus padres eran pobres, y no vieron importante el estudio, ella esta acompañada, y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, con su pareja procrearon 5 hijos, pero actualmente ninguno vive con ellos todos están acompañados, solo viven 2 nietas con ellos de 14 y 7 años, ambas están estudiando.  
Se dedica junto  con su esposo a la agricultura desde hace 4O años, pues es el medio con el que han sacado sus hijos adelante. Comenta que a sus 65 años todavía le ayuda a su esposo en el trabajo agrícola, su día comienza a las 4:30 AM, primero prepara el desayuno para su familia y el café para su esposo, por que el se va temprano. Luego, lleva unas novillas al potrero, para después ir donde esta su esposo, donde trabaja unas cuatro horas y regresa a casa, para prepararles el almuerzo, así a sido toda su vida. 
El crédito, será utilizado en la compra de 1 vaca que este dando leche, ya que quiere aprovechar que el pasto esta bueno y ganar unos dólares.
Su sueño, es comprar unas 3 vacas lecheras, para tener la comida y ya no trabajar en la agricultura pues su esposo y ella ya están de edad. Además, sueña con ver sus nietas graduarse en la universidad, ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, y sus hijos no quisieron seguir estudiando. Con la ganancia si Dios le permite quiere pagar el crédito a Fundación y dejar así las puertas abiertas.
texts.en:
Elia, 65, is a woman who never had the opportunity of attending school because her parents were poor and didn’t think schooling was important.  She has a spouse and her husband works in agriculture.  They had five children but none of them lives with them currently; they all have their own spouses.  Only two granddaughters who are 14 and 7 years old live with them; both are attending school.

She and her husband have worked in agriculture for 40 years and that’s how they’ve supported their children.  She comments that at the age of 65 she still helps her husband with the agricultural work.  Her day starts at 4:30am.  She first prepares her family’s breakfast and coffee for her husband because he leaves early.  Then, she takes her calves to pasture and then head out to meet her husband where she works for about four hours and returns home to prepare lunch.  This is how her entire life has been.

The loan will be used to buy a cow that’s producing milk because she wants to take advantage of the good grass to earn some dollars.  Her dream is to buy about 3 dairy cows to provide food so that she and her husband who are of an age now won’t have to still work in agriculture.  She dreams with seeing her granddaughters graduate from university because she never had the chance to go to school and her children did not want to continue in school either.  

God willing, she wants to use profits to repay the Fundación’s loan thus leaving the doors open.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 48-year-old married woman. She has two children who are 19 and 23 years old. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale and also keeps chickens, which she sells to earn an income. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a good area for business and her primary customers are local residents.
