She describes her biggest business challenge to be her lack of enough money to expand her business. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy animal feed, poultry feed, and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a regional supplier of animal products within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of KES 200,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, poultry feed, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Santos Ernesto

texts.es:
Santos de 42 años, solo estudio 3° grado, debido que sus padres eran pobres y desde muy pequeño le toco que aprender a trabajar, su papá le decía que era mejor aprender a trabajar que estudiar, que eso no le serviría en nada. Él esta  acompañado y su  pareja trabaja con él, en la agricultura,tienen 2 hijos y ya están en la escuela.

 Toda su vida sea dedicado a la agricultura, pues fue su papá que le enseño el oficio, por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en la actividad que realiza. Manifiesta que, en parte agradece a su papá el verle enseñado a trabajar, pero lamenta no haber estudiado, quizás tuviera mejores oportunidades,y un mejor salario. su vida es dura se levanta a las 4:30 AM, ordeña 2 vacas que tiene mientras su señora le prepara el desayuno,luego se encamina al lugar donde trabaja. Para llegar camina uno 25 minutos, trabaja 6 horas, y luego regresa. Pero por la tarde trabaja unas 3 horas en el cultivo propio de él.       

El préstamo sera utilizado en la compra  de una vaca lechera.  Su sueño es poder comprar unas 10 vacas lecheras, y así tener como darles a sus hijos un estudio, para que no se queden como él, además, comprar  un terremo donde puedan construir su propia casa. Ya que hoy donde vive es de un cuñado.
texts.en:
Santos, 42, only completed third grade because his parents were poor and he had to learn how to work when still very young.  His father would say that learning to work was better than going to school because the latter wasn’t good for anything.  He has a spouse who works with him in agriculture and they have two children who are attending school already.

He’s spent his entire life in agriculture since his father taught him the occupation so he has much experience in the work he does.  He states that he’s grateful to a large degree to his father for teaching him to work but rues not having attended school.  Perhaps he would have better opportunities and higher salary.  

His life is hard.  He rises at 4:30am, milks the cows while his wife prepares him breakfast and then heads out to his place of work.  He walks about 25 minutes to get there and works for six hours and then returns.  In the afternoon he works about three hours on a small crop of his own.

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow.  His dream is to be able to buy about 10 dairy cows to have a way to provide schooling for his children so that they won’t grow up to be like him.  Also, to buy a piece of land where they can build their own house since the one they live in now belongs to his brother-in-law.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, aged 53, lives with her spouse and children in her own home in the Kien Svay district of Kandal province. She has been involved in agriculture, an occupation she learned from her parents, for more than 20 years, and wants to continue although it is difficult work requiring a lot of power. However, she wants something different for her children and so strives to support them in school to help them earn a bachelor's degree.


San has applied for a loan to buy materials for building a bathroom. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have good health and a better living standard. She is very happy and thankful because HKL is providing her with a lower interest rate than its standard rate. She awaits your kindness and  your generosity.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a bathroom.

loans.name: Delmy

texts.es:
Doña Delmy de 41 años, estudio hasta tercer año de educación básica, está acompañada, pero su pareja de vida emigro a estados unidos, él se dedica hacer oficios varios: jardinería, albañilería, mesero, entre otros, para poderle ayudar con pequeños ingresos a su familia. 

Su hija de 16 años dejo de estudiar porque salió embarazada, y tiene una bebe de 3 meses, es una madre soltera y el hijo de 20 años cultiva la tierra para la alimentación del núcleo familiar. 

Su negocio es la venta de tortillas, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, anteriormente vendía ropa en }la ciudad. Su madre le enseño este oficio, siendo ella la que le ayuda en el negocio actualmente. Ella está viviendo y tiene el negocio en la casa de su madre, ya que no tiene casa propia, esta casa es de bahareque.  Con ella trabajan, su madre y una prima para dar abasto a los pedidos que le hacen los clientes. Los clientes llegan al lugar a traer las tortillas y en ocasiones tienen que llevárselas a los clientes. Hace esta actividad todos los días.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una plancha y  elaborar más tortillas, ella dice que le cuesta mucho en el comal que tiene y que no da abasto, con esta herramienta será más productiva la jornada, y además no tendrán que estar respirando tanto humo, que les afecta su salud. Generara más ingresos para cubrir gastos diarios.

 Delmy  desea  ampliar su negocio, que este le pueda generar los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia y poder ir ahorrando para en un futuro, construir  su casita;  vivir con sus hijos y nieta en condiciones  dignas.
texts.en:
Delmy, 41, completed third year of basic education.   She has a spouse but he emigrated to the United States.  He does various jobs: gardening, construction work, waiter, among others, to be able to help a little with family income.

Her 16-year-old daughter dropped out of school because she became pregnant; she now has a 3-month-old baby.  She’s a single mother and her 20-year-old son works the land to produce food to feed the family.

Her business is selling tortillas.  She’s been in this activity for five years.  She used to sell clothes in the city.  Her mother taught her this occupation and her mother currently helps her in the business.  She lives in her mother’s house and her business is nearby since she has no house of her own.  The house is wattle and daub.  Her mother and cousin work with her in order to fill all the customer orders she gets.  Customers come by to pick up their tortillas and sometimes they have to be delivered to them.  She does this activity every day.

She needs the loan to buy a griddle to make more tortillas because she says that making them on the clay griddle is too much work and doesn’t produce enough.  With this more productive tool her workday will be more productive and also they won’t be inhaling so much smoke which affects their health.  It will also generate more income to cover daily expenses.

Delmy wants to expand her business so that it will generate the necessary income to support her family and be able to save to build a house in future and live with her children and granddaughter in proper conditions.

loans.use: to buy a griddle to make more tortillas.

loans.name: Néstor Sain

texts.es: Néstor es un joven que a sus 22 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como mototaxista
texts.en: Néstor is 22 and a taxi driver.

loans.use: to buy three pigs to raise.

loans.name: Omar Ernesto

texts.es:
Omar de 27 años, estudio hasta la primaria debido a la situación económica, que presentaban sus padres; ya que se dedican a la agricultura, es acompañado y su compañera se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tiene un hijo de tres años.

se a dedicado desde muy pequeño a la agricultura ya que su padre se a dedicado a esta actividad, trabaja 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y tiene que madrugar a las 4 de la mañana para llegar donde tiene los cultivos, ya que se encuentran a 3 kilómetros de su casa. Ademas, tiene bueyes los utiliza para hacer viajes o otras actividades que corresponden a la agricultura, trabaja en conjunto de sus padres ya que siendo el único hijo les ayuda a trabajar y siempre esta muy pendiente de ellos.
Trabaja desde la madrugada hasta la medio día, después trabaja con los bueyes realizando actividades agrícolas.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, para la compra de insumos agrícolas; abonos, fertilizantes y para preparar la tierra para el cultivo de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, se espera favorecer mejor el cultivo de maíz y lograr tener al final de la cosecha una mayor producción y tener mejores ingresos para su familia.

Espera lograr, construir una vivienda de ladrillo, ya que en la que vive actualmente es de bahareque y comprar animales para repasto.
texts.en:
Omar, 27, only completed elementary school due to his parents’ economic situation because they worked in agriculture.  He has a spouse and his wife does household chores; they have a three-year-old son.

Since he was little he’s worked in agriculture since that was his father’s occupation.  He works 7,000 square meters of corn and has to rise at 4am to reach his parcels that are located 3 kilometers from home.  Also, he has oxen that he uses to make the trip or to do other agricultural chores.  He works alongside his parents since he’s an only son and he helps them work and is always watching over them.  He works from dawn until noon and then works with his oxen doing agricultural chores.

The loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies like manure and fertilizer to prepare the soil to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.  He hopes to better care for the corn crop so that yields at harvest will be larger and family income will increase.

He hopes to build a brick house because the one he currently lives in is daub and wattle; he also wants to buy animals to put out to pasture.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Dilcia Maribel

texts.es: Dilcia, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea de Esparta, Atlántida. Ella estableció su propio negocio hace un ano donde vende productos alimenticios en la pulpería como ser arroz, frijoles, manteca, azúcar, pan, harinas, huevos, refrescos, golosinas, jabón etc. actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para surtir mas su negocio, va comprar embutidos, lácteos, y granos básicos, así podrá ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes. Su meta es sacar adelante a sus hijos y poderles dar la educación necesaria.
texts.en: Dilcia, 30, lives in a free union with her spouse and their two children in a neighborhood in Esparta, Atlántida. A year ago, she opened her own business, a grocery store, where she sells food items such as rice, beans, shortening, sugar, bread, flour, eggs, beverages, sweets, and soap. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy canned goods, milk products, and grains to stock her store and offer her customers more variety. Her goal is to provide for her children and give them the education they need.

loans.use: to buy grains, milk products, and canned goods to sell in her small grocery store.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando es empleado del Ministerio Público, y  está estudiando en el segundo Año de la carrera de Derecho, es soltero, y cuenta que tiene como meta poder ser un gran profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas.
Comenta que su aspiración es su familia, ya que ellos siempre han estado a su lado, dándole su mayor apoyo y ha sido su sostén. Hoy Rolando solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y estando cada vez más cerca de su meta.
texts.en: Rolando works for the Interior Ministry, is in his second year of law school, and is single. He says his goal is to become a professional who helps others. His family inspires him, as they have always been at his side and supported him.  Rolando has applied for a loan to pay his college fees so that he can continue studying and be closer to achieving his goal.

loans.use: to pay college fees.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo es de la ciudad de Ybycui, está estudiando la carrera de derecho, con el que podrá convertirse en un excelente abogado. Es un joven muy dedicado que tiene muchos sueños y anhelos por los que lucha para poder sacarlos adelante y sobresalir siempre en lo que hace.
Él solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus gastos de titulación, ya que con el podrá cubrirlos, ya que es un poco costoso.
El agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, y con la que podrá ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcelo is from the city of Ybycui. He is studying Law so that he can become an excellent lawyer.  He is a very dedicated young man with lots of dreams and goals. He struggles to get ahead and always excels in what he does.

Marcelo is requesting this loan to invest in paying the costs of his education. With this help he can cover them as they are somewhat expensive. He is grateful for the opportunity being offered him. He hopes to be able to help his family with his degree.

loans.use: to pay for his education.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es:
El Señor Bruno tiene 62 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos, él reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Yorito, Departamento de Yoro.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura, en la actualidad se dedica a la reparación y fabricación de zapatos. Él fabrica zapato formal (chinelas) y zapatos de trabajo.
Bruno ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 22,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de cuero, cuerina, zuela, pegamento y cordones, con esta inversión espera mejorar sus ventas ya que estará disponiendo de variedad de calzado para abastecer la demanda. Él espera invertir parte de sus ganancias en la compra de equipo que le facilite su trabajo y ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Bruno, 62, is married and has five children. He lives with his family in a rural town outside the city of Yorito in Yoro department. He used to farm, but now he repairs and makes dress and work shoes.

Bruno has applied for a loan of 22,000 lempiras to buy leather, imitation leather, soles, glue, and laces. He expects that this investment will increase sales because he will have a variety of shoes to meet customer demand. He hopes to invest some of his profit in purchasing equipment that will facilitate his work and result in better customer service.

loans.use: to buy leather, imitation leather, soles, glue, and laces.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 32 years old and married. She has four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for 13 years, and she earns additional income from pig fattening.

Anabel is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF, in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 43 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school. Virginia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, a business she has been engaged in for 11 years.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, and eggs.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, and milk

loans.name: Luis Alberto Group

texts.en:
Aaron, José Ismael, and Carlos have dedicated their lives to the harvest of “chigua,” corn, and beans in the community of “La Florida,” which is a small village in the state of Campeche.  Through hard work, this group of men will be able to acquire a clean energy source through solar home systems. 

Aaron is 63 years old and has always worked as a peasant in the state of Campeche in order to provide for the 5 members of his family.  Working in the fields and the countryside is almost a family trade, since all members dedicate a considerable amount of time to the harvest of beans, corn and bananas.  They consider themselves lucky because they own a small piece of land that allows them to cultivate goods and generate some income. 

Through hard work, they were able to purchase a solar home system that has not been enough for their needs since it only has one light bulb.  By purchasing the new solar home system, they intend to charge their new cellphones and finally have the ability to communicate with relatives or be contacted if there is an emergency.  Also, with two light bulbs they will be able to have better lighting quality, which will translate to a better sense of security. 

Aaron expressed that, “the possibility of charging a cellphone will give access to communication to my family - something I never thought I could provide.”

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will replace the use of candles.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
This is Janet. She previously obtained an 18,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 10,000 PHP. She will use it to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add into her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Janet dreams that her business will get bigger and hopes to have a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her store's inventory

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is 53 years old and has six children, one of whom is in school. Brigida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been doing this work for four years.

Brigida requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to buy additional feed for her pigs. She has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF, to sustain this business activity. In the future, Brigida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Danna

texts.en:
Danna is 28 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are in school.

Danna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Danna requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Danna has been raising pigs for four years.

In the future, Danna would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha. She previously obtained a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in covering her and her husband's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy gardening materials, like wire and baskets, and supplies such as seed and fertilizer, for her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her meet their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Editha hopes to expand her business and dreams that her family will always stick together and be happy. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and other materials, for her ornamental plant-growing business.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
Luciana quiere ser una excelente profesional y ejercer su carrera de abogada, para poder ayudar a la gente que necesite de su profesión.
Está logrando con mucho sacrificio ya que tiene que trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo para poder cubrir los gastos de sus estudios. Es una persona que está esforzándose al máximo para poder cumplir con sus metas.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y también para invertirlo en sus gastos de manutención, lo que le será de gran ayuda para poder seguir estudiando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Luciana wants to be an excellent professional and start her career as a lawyer to be able to help people that need someone of her profession. She is achieving with much sacrifice given that she has to work and study at the same time in order to be able to cover her study expenses. She is a person who is striving to the maximum to be able to achieve her goals.

She is applying for this loan to be able to invest it in paying her installments and also to invest it in her support costs. It will be a great help to be able to continue studying. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay installments support costs.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es la menor de 3 hermanos, está estudiando su segunda carrera universitaria y trabajando actualmente en atención al cliente de una empresa. Su sueño es llegar a crear su propia empresa de diseño de modas ya que fue la primera carrera que culmino.
Esta carrera que está estudiando es la de Marketing y publicidad, y comenta que quiere poder unir sus dos carrera y así ser una excelente profesional.
Solicita de este crédito, ya que quiere invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, que le permitirá seguir estudiando y aligerar su carga. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Luz is the youngest of three siblings. She is studying her second university degree and currently working in the customer service department of a business. Her dream is to create her own fashion design business; this was the first degree that she earned. 

The degree that she is studying is that of Marketing and Publicity, and she says that the wants to be able to link her two degrees and therefore be an excellent professional. She is applying for this loan, given that she wants to invest it in the payment of her installments. This will let her continue studying and lighten her load. She is thankful for this opportunity that she receives.

loans.use: to pay university installments.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, 55, is a married woman, and she has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years.

Marilou requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional fruit to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruit to sell

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 23 years old and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Karen runs a business, selling firewood in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to purchase additional firewood to sell. In the future, Karen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 38 years old and married. She has three children. Lucresia works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for eight years, and she also earns an income from selling fruit.

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. Lucresia has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF, before this loan. 

Lucresia aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell at her store

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas es un grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación, que  hace 15 ciclos esta unido trabajando, en la actualidad están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, con el que pueden conocer la situación integral de cada una de ellas.
Una integrante es la Sra. Candelaria, ella tiene un kiosko en su casa con todo tipo de insumos y con lo cual está luchando para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan. Candelaria es una persona muy luchadora, que quiere mejorar su situación de pobreza y crecer en su microemprendimiento y el crédito lo utilizará para la compra de comestibles para su negocio y así poder surtirlo y seguir dando a sus clientes lo que buscan.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas is a group from the city of Encarnación that has had 15 loans so far. They are currently participating in a survey focused on eliminating poverty, which will allow them to get to know the unique situation of each member.

One member, Candelaria, has a kiosk in her home where she sells different types of supplies. With her kiosk, she is fighting to be able to provide her family with everything that they need. Candelaria is a determined person who wants to get out of poverty and expand her small business venture. She will use her loan to purchase food products for her business to stock it and continue to provide the things her customers need.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Valentín

texts.es:
El señor Valentín tiene 69 años y está Casado con la señora Ramona quien tiene 64 años,  ambos tienen hijos, pero todos ya mayores que están de manera independiente.
El señor Valentín se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad abasteciendo la demanda de las despensas de las ciudades de Altos, Loma Grande y Nueva Colombia. El es una persona muy trabajadora, que con su esfuerzo pudo sacar adelante a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan, y hacer de ellos personas de bien.  
Solicita el Crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos al por mayor para abaratar los costos, como ser aceites, jabones, leche y demás. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Valentín, 69, is married to Ramona, 64. Both have children, but they’re already old enough that they are independent. Valentín makes his living selling staple products, fulfilling the demand of the stores of the cities of Altos, Loma Grande and Nueva Colombia. He is a very hardworking person, and with his effort he was able to bring his family ahead and given them everything they need, and make them good people.

He is applying for this loan to invest it in the purchase of bulk materials to cheapen his costs, like oil, soaps, milk and more. He is thankful for this opportunity that he receives that will be of much help to him.

loans.use: to buy oil, soaps, milk and more.

loans.name: Oybek

texts.ru: Ойбек умный и начитанный молодой человек. Ему 18 лет. Он не женат. Ойбек студент 1 курса Технического Института Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Он в средней школе учился отлично. Ойбек имеет хорошую репутацию среди сокурсников. Он в свободное время помогает родителям по домохозяйству. Ойбек занимается изучением иностранных языков. Ойбек мечтает после окончания университета работать в банке. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Oybek is a smart and well-read young man. He is 18 years old. He is not married. Oybek is a first year student at the Technical Institute of the Technological University of Tajikistan. In high school he studied well. 

Oybek has a good reputation among his classmates. In his spare time he helps his parents with the household. Oybek studies foreign languages. Oybek dreams of working at a bank after finishing university. He needs to pay for his tuition. He requests a loan to pay for the tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for education at the university

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for her tricycle. The loan also helped in the education of her child. She has a direct-selling business, for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. She will use this loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of the tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda dreams of obtaining an additional unit of tricycle, and hopes to have a happy family. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance on the motorized tricycle unit.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es estudiante, aspira a ser licenciada en enfermería para poder ayudar a su familia cuando tenga un trabajo digno, ayudarles a ellos por el apoyo que en todo momento le  brindaron.
Ella quiere poder tener un buen puesto en un centro asistencial de salud y así poder desarrollarse y crecer como profesional. Es una persona que se destaca por dar todo de sí para sobresalir.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases de la universidad, y así estar más cerca de su meta y poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Claudia is a student, she aspires to have a Bachelor of Nursing to be able to help her family once she gets a dignified job, help them for all the support that they have always provided her.
She wants to have a good position in a health center and be able to develop and grow as a professional.  She is a person that stands out for giving her all to excel.
She requests this loan to invest it in paying for her University classes and this way be closer to her goal and continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for University classes.

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
El grupo de nombre Jovenes Emprendedores está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de jóvenes,  ellos son todos jóvenes que quieren poder emprender un trabajo y así poder ayudar a sus familias.
La señorita Karina es una de las integrantes, ella es presidenta  del grupo y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de Repostería tales como: pastafrola, alfajor, pionono, torta, budín etc. Ella también es estudiante. Por medio de su esfuerzo por salir adelante ella logró mejorar su calidad de vida, de sus ingresos de venta solventa sus gastos de estudios, vestimenta entre otros.
Solicita este crédito  para comprar insumos para seguir haciendo sus productos de repostería, como ser harina, dulces, azúcar, y demás, ya que con ello podrá aumentar su negocio y tener más ingresos. En la foto hay 6 personas, ya que también esta uno de los codeudores firmantes.
texts.en:
The group named "Jovenes Emprendedores" [Youth Entrepreneurs] is in its fifth loan cycle of the youth committee program. They are all youth that want to be able to start a business and thus be able to help their families.

Karina is one of the members. She is the president of the group and she works making and selling baked goods like: pastafrola, alfajor, pionono, [local baked goods], cakes, pudding, etc. She is also a student. By means of her efforts to get ahead she has achieved improving her quality of life. Her income from sales covers her school expenses, clothes and more.

She is applying for this loan to buy supplies to continue making her baked goods, like flour, sweets, sugar and more. With these she will be able to grow her business and have more income. In the photo there are 6 people; they are also co-borrowers.

loans.use: to buy flour, sweets, sugar, and more to make baked goods.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора трудолюбивая и целеустремленная девушка. Ей 22 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она более 3 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она имеет свой кондитерский цех. Она выпекает разные виды булочек и реализует в продуктовых магазинах. Она вначале работала как кондитер в частном кондитерском цехе и постепенно открыла свой бизнес. Она справляется с бизнесом успешно. Нигоре помогают брат и отец. Нигора хочет пополнить оборотный капитал. С такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки муки, сахара, соль, орехи, начинки и один новый кондитерский рецепт. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Nigora is a hardworking and purposeful girl. She is 22 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. She has had her own business for more than three years. She has her own pastry store. She bakes different types of buns and rolls and sells them in her store. In the beginning she worked as a pastry-cook in a private pastry store and step by step opened her own business. She is coping well with the business. Nigora's brother and father help her. 

Nigora would like to replenish her working capital. With this aim she requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to purchase flour, sugar, salt, nuts, fillings and a new pastry recipe. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, salt etc to increase her working capital

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe, of San Carlos, Tukuran, runs a transportation services business, together with her husband. Aside from this, she is also engaged in vending snacks in town, to earn a living.

Fe has successfully repaid her previous loans, which she used for repairs to her transport vehicle. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 5,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy raw ingredients for her snacks. She wants to improve the general living conditions of her family, in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал родился в 1987 года. После окончания средней школы у него не было возможности поступить в университет. Он обучился у плотника его мастерством. Акмал занимался этим мастерством и зарабатывал деньги. После того как он накопил деньги, он поступил в университет по специальности историка. Данное время он является студентом 3 курса. Он и работает и учится. Акмал еще не женат. После окончания университета он мечтает работать в музее. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Akmal was born in 1987. After finishing high school it was not possible for him to enter university. He learnt carpentry skills from a carpenter. Akmal worked using these skills and earned money. 

After Akmal had saved up money, he entered university, specializing in history. Currently he is a third year student. He both works and studies. Akmal is not married. After graduating from university he dreams of working at a museum. He requests a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition at the university

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилорому 40 лет. Она в родительском доме научилась шитью женской одежды. Ее профессия ей очень пригодилась, когда она вышла замуж. Первый брак был неудачным, так как ее муж много пил и избивал ее. После развода она пережила трудные времена. В этот период она зарабатывала на жизнь одна. После 5 лет она во второй раз вышла замуж и нашла своё счастье. Она помогает своему мужу по обеспечению семьи, так как доход ее мужа не хватает для содержания семьи. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды. Дилором уже 6 цикл кредитуется в ИМОНе и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 650 сомони для покупки необходимого средства для домохозяйства. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilorom is 40 years old. She learnt to sew women's clothing in her childhood home. Her profession was very useful to her when she got married. Her first marriage was not unfortunate, as her husband drank a lot and beat her up. After the divorce she survived through a difficult period. In this period she earned money for living by herself. 

After five years Dilorom got married for the second time, and found happiness. She helps her husband provide for the family, as her husband's income is not enough to support the family. She works with sewing women's clothing. 

Dilorom has already gotten a loan from IMON six times, and she has a good credit history. She requests a loan in the amount of 650 somoni to purchase necessary household products. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase household products for her family

loans.name: Franciney

texts.es: Franciney, a sus 41 años de edad, es padre de tres hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Desde hace 9 años se dedica a cultivar flores de la especie solidago, las cuales vende a diferentes comercializadoras de flores de la región, cuenta con el apoyo de un trabajador de tiempo completo y una vez por semana contrata los servicios de otra persona. Durante toda su vida productiva se ha dedicado a la agricultura, pues ha tenido varios cultivos de diversos productos, pero, en vista de los bajos resultados decidió buscar otras opciones y por ello incursionó en el campo de la floricultura, con el ánimo de mejorar la entrada de recursos para el sostenimiento de su familia. El cliente es un hombre pujante, activo, trabajador y perseverante, no se desanima ante las adversidades que se le presentan, manifiesta que su mayor desafío es la competencia y el bajo nivel de flujo de efectivo, pues sus clientes pagan a 3 meses, dificultando así la compra de abonos y riegos necesarios para los cultivos. Esto lo lleva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, con el que desea comprar abonos, riegos, fertilizantes y semillas para cultivar nuevas matas y seguir cuidando las que ya tiene sembradas, así podrá aumentar su producción y tendrá la posibilidad de incrementar su clientela, lo que se reflejará a mediano plazo en el incremento de los ingresos que recibe por la venta de sus productos. De esta manera, Franciney tiene la oportunidad de seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su principal objetivo que es ampliar sus cultivos y cuidarlos de manera adecuada para ofrecer un producto de excelente calidad, además podrá generar más empleo, mejorando así, la calidad de vida y el bienestar de su familia y la de muchas otras personas que influyen en toda esta ardua labor,
texts.en:
Franciney, who is 41 years old, is the father of three children and lives in a common law marriage with his partner. Nine years ago, he began to cultivate goldenrod flowers, which he sells to different flower marketers in the region. He counts on the support of a full-time employee and another person who works one day per week.

He has spent his whole career in agriculture. He has grown many different products but, due to the low results, decided to pursue other options. He decided to pursue flower growing with the goal of improving his income and sustaining his family. He is a thriving, active, hardworking, and persevering man. He does not get discouraged in the face of difficulties that arise. 

He reports that his greatest challenge is competition and low cash flow, since his clients pay once every three months. This makes it difficult to purchase the necessary manure and irrigation for his crops. This is why he is requesting a loan. He would like to purchase manure, irrigation, fertilizer, and seed to grow new plants and continue caring for his current crops. He hopes to increase his production and have the opportunity to increase his customers, which will result in an increase in the income that he receives in the medium term. 

Franciney has the opportunity to continue to advance toward his main goal, which is to expand his crops and care for them adequately in order to provide a high-quality product. Additionally, he will be able to generate employment, improving his family's well-being and quality of life, as well as that of other people who are involved in this difficult work.

loans.use: to buy manure, irrigation, fertilizer, and seeds to cultivate new plants and continue caring for his current crops.

loans.name: Bernardo José

texts.es: Bernardo tiene 36 años de edad y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Actualmente se dedica a laborar como vigilante desde hace varios años. Con el ánimo de mejorar los ingresos familiares, él desea iniciar su propio negocio, pues con el salario que gana en su actual empleo no le alcanza para cubrir todos los gastos del hogar; es por ello que comenzará una distribuidora de pollo y carnes frías, que estará ubicado en el barrio donde reside, aprovechando la ventaja de no poseer competencia fuerte en el sector y la afluencia de gente que transita por el lugar, pues es una zona residencial. Esto lo motiva a solicitar el apoyo de su primer ciclo de crédito, el cual será invertido en la compra de activos fijos (nevera y congelador) y surtido al por mayor (pollo, carnes frías), con lo que podrá dar inicio a su proyecto emprendedor, con el que pretende mejorar sus ingresos para solventar los gastos y necesidades básicas del hogar. Bernardo es un hombre pujante y luchador, además es consciente que debe trabajar arduamente para lograr los objetivos que se propone con este nuevo negocio. Esto le da la posibilidad de seguir adelante, luchando por cumplir su principal sueño que es tener más sucursales dentro del municipio donde reside y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Bernardo, 36, has a common-law marriage with his partner. He currently works as a security guard, and has done this for several years. With the intention of improving his family's income, he decided to start his own business, since the salary he earns in his current job is not enough to cover the household expenses. This is why he is starting a chicken and cold cuts distributor, which will be located in the neighborhood where he lives. It will take advantage of not having any strong competition in the sector and the affluence of people who come through, since it is a residential area. This motivates him to apply for his first loan cycle, which will be invested in fixed assets (refrigerator and freezer) and wholesale stock (chicken, cold cuts), with which he will be able to start his entrepreneurial project. With this, he intends to improve his income in order to meet the expenses and basic needs of his household. Bernardo is a man who thrives and he is determined. He also knows that he needs to work hard to reach the objectives posed by this new business. This gives him the possibility of moving forward, fighting to achieve his dream, which is to have more branches in the city where he lives and this way improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (refrigerator and freezer) and wholesale stock (chicken, cold cuts).

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.ru: Насибахон родилась в 1994 года. Она в прошлом году вышла замуж. Ее муж работает в средней школе учителем. Его зарплата низкая и поэтому в свободное время он занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур. Последний год у них возникла финансовая проблема, так как у них было много расходов для проведения свадебного торжества. Насибахон трудолюбивая невестка и поэтому семья мужа поддержала ее, когда она сказала им свою идею поступить в Педагогический Институт. В этом году она поступила в институт, и теперь она студентка 1 курса. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 350 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nasibakhon was born in 1994. Last year she got married. Her husband works as a high school teacher. His pay is low and therefore he works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation in his spare time. Last year they had financial problems, as they had many expenses from holding the wedding party. 

Nasibakhon is a hardworking daughter-in-law and therefore her husband's family supported her when she told them of her idea to enter the Pedagogical Institute. This year she started at the institute, and currently she is a first year student. She needs to pay for her tuition. She requests a loan in the amount of 350 US dollar to pay for the tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition at the university

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es: Emerson, de 31 años, está casado con Idaura con quien tiene un hijo de 2 años, actualmente vive en el terreno de su suegra en donde le brindaron un espacio para vivir con su familia. La actividad de Emerson, como todos los días, es de conducir mototaxi, realiza su trabajo por las principales calles de la ciudad en busca de sus eventuales pasajeros a quienes transporta hasta su destino con bastante serenidad ya que considera que la seguridad de sus clientes es lo más importante, de la misma manera siempre brinda su numero de celular para que pueda ser contactado por algún cliente que necesita de su servicio de transporte. Los 5 años de experiencia y la calidad de su trabajo lo coloca como una pieza clave en el oficio que desarrolla. Complementa su trabajo con la venta de ropa ya que lo considera otra actividad rentable. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, es por eso que agradece a quienes hacen posible este financiamiento que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la refacción de su mototaxi para que funcione de manera óptima, otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en el acondicionamiento de su local de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Emerson is 31 years old and married to Idaura.  They have a two-year-old son.  Emerson currently lives on a plot of land provided by his mother-in-law so that he could have a space where he can live with his family.  Every day he conducts his business of driving a motorcycle taxi.  His work consists of traveling through the main streets of the city in search of passengers.  Emerson takes his customers to their destination without incident and he believes safety is the most important factor.  He always gives out his mobile phone number so that customers can contact him whenever they need transportation services.  Emerson has five years of experience and the quality of his work is the key behind developing his trade.  

Emerson complements this business by selling clothes, which he considers to be a profitable venture.  He is taking this opportunity to request 3,000 PEN.  For this reason, he is grateful to those who made this loan possible since it will help him accomplish his goals.  In addition, he promises to complete his payments in a punctual manner.  The amount he requested will be invested in the repair of his motorcycle taxi so that it will function in an optimal manner.  Part of the money will be invested in the renovation of his clothing shop.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his motorcycle taxi and to renovate his clothing shop.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is married with three children and resides in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband earns income operating a tricycle transportation service while she runs a retail store selling fruit in town to make a living. She borrowed 15,000 PHP to buy more fruit for sale. She plans to use her generated revenue as additional capital for her business expansion. She hopes to improve the living condition of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more fruit for sale

loans.name: Crisencio

texts.en:
This is Crisencio, 34, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Marilou and they have children. At this time, he is working hard to  provide income for his family's everyday expenses.

Crisencio oversees operations of their jeepney transportation business. He has one Jeep unit that carries up to 16 passengers to their destination within the community. He earns income from the boundary (daily quota) his driver remits everyday. Regular passengers and customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will use the loan for spare parts and the maintenance of his Jeepney unit.

Crisencio hopes that his income will always be good and he dreams of giving his children a quality education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: 02.01.14 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Bích is 28 years old, and she is married, with two children.  She lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Bích has a retail business selling sugar, candy, milk, and processed food.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, candy, milk, and processed food for resale.   She has been involved in this business for one year.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concern her is the lack of capital.

This is Bích's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.   She is the group leader of the 02.01.14 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

With her business profit, Bích hopes for her family to be healthy and happy; for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, candy, milk, and processed food for resell

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She has two children and is married to a farmer. She raises pigs to resell in the future. She borrowed a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy piglets to raise. She wants to use her revenue from her pigs to build a livestock shelter to improve her business. She wants to see her children successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow and avocados, mandarin oranges, and other in-season items in bulk.

loans.name: Mayra Adela

texts.es:
Mayra es una mujer dedicada a la enseñanza principalmente de los niños de  educación  primaria,  con 10 años de laborar,  casada con 3 hijos a su cargo, ella tiene una necesidad actualmente debido a la época lluviosa de mejorar su vivienda, con la reparación del techo y pared,  utilizando dicho financiamiento en la   Compra de Zinc, Ladrillo Rojo, Cemento, Arena, Hierro, Perlin y Mano de Obra.
Esta obra de construcción le vendrá a solución tan ansiado problema y mejorar las condiciones del hogar
texts.en:
Mayra works teaching, mainly children in primary school. She has ten years of working experience. She is married and has three children under her care. Because of the rainy season, she currently needs to improve her home by repairing the roof and walls. She will use this financing to purchase zinc, red brick, cement, sand, iron, gravel, and labor.

This construction work will solve such a pressing problem and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for zinc, red brick, cement, sand, iron, gravel, and labor.

loans.name: Aravoi Group

texts.es:
Las 14 integrantes de este comité son mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias. Una de ellas es la Sra.  Vilia, quien es la presidenta del comité, ella es dueña de una olería, en la que trabaja muy duro, y es el medio con el que mantiene a su familia y les da para el día a día.
Es una persona muy entusiasta que con mucho esfuerzo fue consiguiendo todo lo que tiene. Ella solicita su crédito para invertirlo en la compra de arcillas para su olería, para la elaboración de ladrillos y así seguir trabajando y luchando por ir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The 14 members of this committee are female heads of households who have joined together so that they can help their families.  

One of these women is Sra. Vilia, who is the committee president.  She is the owner of a brickyard.  The work is very hard, but it enables her to support her family and provide for their daily needs.  

Vilia is an enthusiastic person who has put a great deal of effort into obtaining everything that she has.  She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of clay for her brickyard.  She will use this material for making bricks, which allows her to continue working and striving so that she can improve her life.

loans.use: to buy clay for making bricks.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres luchadoras esta haciendo su encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 de estas mujeres están en el indicador rojo, ya que tienen bajos ingresos, pero deben seguir esforzándose.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Matilde, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir con ingresos medios. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que hace venta de bijouteries y, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropas para vender, lo que le ayudará a tener algo nuevo que poder adherir a su venta de bijouterie. Todas las integrantes agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Luchadoras Group is participating in the poverty elimination survey. Six of these women have red indicators because they have low incomes, but they should continue to work hard.

One of the members of this group is Matilde. During the last survey, she was at the second level on the poverty scale, which is to say that she has a medium income. Through her effort, her continuous work, and applying the behavior of a successful woman, she is improving her state of poverty. Among the work she does, she says that she sells jewelry. The work of the advisors should also be highlighted. They continuously follow up with training and checks, which both demand and encourage these women to fight to overcome poverty.

Matilde is applying for a loan to buy clothing to sell, which will help her to have something new to complement her jewelry business. All of the members are grateful for the opportunity they are being given.

loans.use: to buy clothing to complement her jewelry business.

loans.name: 12 De Junio Group

texts.es:
12 de junio es un grupo muy trabajador, que está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y mediante ello se puede conocer como cada una de ellas se encuentra en lo económico y en lo general.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Claudia, quien es una excelente manicurista, ya que hace todo tipo de trabajos. Es gracias a su trabajo que tiene los medios que le permite poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día. Se hizo de muy buena clientela, y es así que quiere seguir creciendo.
Claudia solicita de este crédito para la compra de esmaltes, acetonas, algodón, limas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con su excelente servicio.
texts.en:
June 12th is very hard working group, they are answering the poverty elimination survey, through which it can be known how each of them are doing economically and in general.
One of the members is Claudia, who is an excellent manicurist, because she can do all sorts of jobs.  Thanks to her work she has the means to be able to help her family with what they need day to day.  She has a good client base and wants to continue to grow.  Claudia requests this loan to buy nail polish, nail polish remover, cotton balls, nail filers and other items and this way continue providing excellent service.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, nail polish remover, cotton balls, nail filers and other items.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
La Sra. Fabiana es soltera y vive con sus padres, ella está administrando su propia confección, producción y ventas de uniformes, en un local que ella misma mando construir con sus propios ingresos.
Fabiana gracias al trabajo que está realizando ya tiene conformado sus propios clientes que siempre le piden que han uniformes para la venta. Gracias al trabajo que está realizando ayuda con sus ingresos a su familia para una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos para seguir con sus confección.
texts.en: Fabiana is single and lives with her parents. She manages her own business sewing, producing, and selling uniforms in an establishment that she herself ordered to be built with her own funds. Thanks to the work that she is doing, Fabiana already has her own customers who always ask that there be uniforms for sale. Thanks to her work, she helps with the family's income to get a better quality of life. She has shown that she is a very responsible and honest person in her commitments. She is applying for this loan to be able to buy fabric and thread to continue with her sewing.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en:
Thorng, 58, is married and has six children. He is a diligent farmer who raises rice crops on his own farmland in Pursat province. He has been involved in this business for 33 years and has never had any problems to date. Farming is the major source of his income which he uses to cover his living costs and support his children in their studies.

He has bought some materials for building a latrine, but the materials are not enough due to insufficient funds. That’s why he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,000 US dollars to buy additional materials and to pay for laborers. He believes that, through the loan, he will be able to increase his family's personal hygiene and provide good living conditions for his family. He is very happy and thankful, because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate better than its general loan. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a latrine and to pay for laborers.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is married, with four children. He describes himself as self-motivated. 

He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, and other household items. He has been involved in this business for two years.  His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are local residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. 

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to add stocks of sugar, maize flour, and other foodstuffs for resale. His business goal is to expand within five years.

 He hopes that in the future, he will succeed and have a happy family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stocks of sugar, maize flour, and other foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: 3.14.341.03.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Năm has a service business repairing motorcycles. She is requesting a loan to purchase instruments to maintain her motobike repair shop.

Năm is 23 years old, and she is married with one child.  She is the group leader of the 3.14.341.03.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of four members.  She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Năm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Năm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Năm has been involved in her business for five years.  The main business hardship that Năm faces is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Năm hopes to maintain  a successful business; for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase instruments to maintain her motobike repair shop.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señorita Gloria tiene 33 años, tiene dos hijos de 15 y 1 año de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo en la Ciudad de Paraguarí. Gloria es profesión peluquera desde hace más de 10 años, trabaja en una peluquería muy reconocida de la ciudad, también cuenta con una peluquería en su casa donde realiza trabajo en forma particular. Es una señora muy conocida en la zona por su sacrificio y ganas de trabajar que demuestra todos los días. 
 Solicitó el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos, para poder surtir con ello su salón de belleza. Agradece por esta oportunidad de progreso que recibe.
texts.en:
Gloria, 33, has two children, ages 1 and 15. She lives in her own house with her husband in the city of Paraguarí. 

Gloria has been a hairdresser for more than 10 years. She works in a very well-known hair salon in the city. She also has a hair salon in her home where she works by appointment. She is a very well-known woman in the area because of her sacrifice and the desire to work which she shows every day.

She has applied for a loan to buy cosmetics to keep her beauty salon stocked. She is grateful to receive this opportunity to make progress.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 44 años, es madre de 2 hijas con quienes vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo. Rocío tiene como trabajo el alquiler de cuartos en su casa .  Lleva en éste trabajo más de 10 años y lo hace sola ya que es un trabajo simple. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que le da buenos ingresos, además de poder estar en su casa con sus hijas, espera mas adelante mejorar las condiciones de su casa para así alquilar sus cuartos a un mejor precio. Este es el préstamo número 05 con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que le permitirá estar tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará materiales para construcción ya que comenzará con la ampliación de sus cuartos y mejorará las condiciones de los mismos, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus inquilinos.
texts.en: Rocío, 44, is the mother of two daughters, whom she lives with in her own house, alongside her husband. Rocío rents out rooms in her house. She has been in this line of work for more than 10 years and she does it by herself because it is a simple job. What she likes most about her work is that it provides a good income. In addition, she is able to be at home with her daughters. She hopes in the future to be able to improve the condition of her house in order to be able to rent out her rooms at a better price. This is her fifth loan with Kiva. She is very glad to know that she has financial support, because it allows her to be calm and and move forward with her plans for her business. She also promises to make her payments on time. With the 1,000 soles that she has asked for, she will buy construction materials, since she will start expanding her rooms and improve their condition, in order to provide better service for her renters.

loans.use: to buy materials to expand the rooms that she rents out.

loans.name: Porsperidad Group

texts.es:
Prosperidad es un grupo de mujeres, está en su ciclo número 21º del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante por medio de ese trabajo en conjunto. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 1 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, luchando por mejorar.
Una persona a destacar a la señora Gloria, quien es peluquera, y comenta que siempre da un buen servicio a sus clientes es el porqué vuelven siempre, es gracias a eso que esta creciendo. Gloria comenta que al principio le fue muy difícil, pero que hoy en días ya tiene su clientela bien formada.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues,  tintes, cremas, y demás insumos para podre seguir estudiando e ir mejorando.
texts.en:
Prosperidad is a group of women which is in its 21st cycle of the committee program. All of the members work and help each other to succeed through their work together. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey. One of the members is below the poverty line and is fighting to improve.

One member to highlight is Gloria, who is a hairdresser. She says that she always gives her clients a good service, which is why they always come back. Thanks to this, she is growing. Gloria says that it was very difficult in the beginning, but now she has a solid clientele. 

She is applying for this loan to invest in the purchase of hair dye, shampoo, rinses, creams, and other supplies so that she can continue studying and improving.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, shampoo, rinses, creams, and other products.

loans.name: Samini

texts.en:
The story of Yuli, daughter of Samini:

"I was born and raised in an unpretentious family.  Our daily life is far from the word 'prosper'.  My parents work as laborers whose income is unstable.  I want to help change our conditions, but it looks like I can’t be much of help yet.  I am a first grader in vocational school now which is clearly giving another burden to our economic condition.  That‘s why by joining this program, there will be a way for me to keep on studying and at the same time, lighten my parents’s burden."

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Sarno

texts.en:
The story of Resti, daughter of Sarno :

"I am the first of three children.  My younger siblings are elementary school students.  I am a first grader in vocational school now.  However, it looks like my parents are having trouble funding our studies.  The money we get from selling meatballs is nearly sufficient to fund our daily needs.  To be honest, I don’t want to give my parents any more trouble, but I’m still in no position to be of much help.  That’s why I’d be glad if there’s a way for me to keep on studying without giving my parents more trouble."

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Julie requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Julie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Supriyadi

texts.en:
The story of Alfi, son of Supriyadi:

"I just graduated from junior high school and planned to study in vocational school.  However, my parents don’t have enough money to fund my studies there.  My parents work as laborers with no stable income.  I have one younger sibling who is still a fourth grader in elementary school who needs to be funded, too.  I always think about how to continue my studies without being any trouble to my parents.  I hope there will be a way for me to keep on studying so I can make my dreams come true one day by joining this program."

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda, de 61 años, está casada con Silvio y tiene 3 hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes, ahora solo trabaja para ella y su nieta de 13 años a quien educa en su casa propia. Erlinda se dedica a la confección de sabanas de diversos diseños, además de algunas fundas para almohadas, muebles y juegos completos de dormitorio, tiene su pequeño taller en  su casa donde realiza todo su trabajo. 
Lleva con éste negocio más de 12 años, en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijas o de su nieta, pues ella sale a ofrecer sus productos los fines de semana a amigos, vecinos y familiares o a cualquier cliente que desee tener una juego de dormitorio de buena calidad y a muy buen precio. Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite tener tiempo para ver a sus animalitos y a sus plantas ya que uno de sus pasatiempos favoritos es sembrar flores en su jardín, tiene muchos planes a futuro ya que desea seguir creciendo y haciendo prosperar a su negocio. Este es su cuarto crédito con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un respaldo financiero para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará materiales para seguir haciendo su trabajo como telas para sabanas, hilos, elásticos, entre otros, y lograr aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Erlinda, who is 61, is married to Silvio and has three adult and independent children. She currently works just for herself and her granddaughter, whom she is raising in her home. Erlinda works making different styles of sheets, as well as some pillow cases, slipcovers, and full bedding sets. She works in a small sewing shop she has set up in her home. 

She has been in this business for over twelve years. Sometimes she gets help from her daughters or her granddaughter, since on the weekends she goes out to offer her products to friends, neighbors, relatives, and any customers who are interested in high quality bedding sets at a very good price. She enjoys her work because it allows her enough time to tend to her animals and plants, since one of her favorite passtimes is growing flowers in her garden. She has many plans for the future because she wants to keep growing and making her business prosper. 

This is her fourth loan through Kiva. She is very happy to know she has the financial backing to keep moving forward. She also promises to pay her installments on time. 

She will use the requested amount of 3,000 soles to purchase materials to keep working, such as fabric for sheets, thread, elastic bands, and other items, so that she can increase production.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic bands, and other items.

loans.name: Sidy

texts.fr: Monsieur Sidy est un jeune homme très ambitieux, il habite dans le même quartier ou se situe le Guichet. Il est marié et père de famille. Agé de 33ans, il  évolue dans la confection et la vente des vêtements et a une expérience de 8ans dans ce domaine. Il demande ce montant pour acheter des tissus, les confectionner, les exposer dans son atelier de couture et après les vendre à ses clients. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h du soir. Sidy souhaite disposer d’un autre atelier de couture afin de diversifier ses produits et pouvoir épargner de l’argent.
texts.en:
Sidy is a young man with a lot of ambition, and lives in the same neighborhood as the UIMCEC branch. He is 33 years of age, married, and a father. Sidy works making clothes, and has eight years of experience in this field. 

Sidy has requested this loan to buy fabric, which he will use to make clothes to display in his dressmaking workshop and then sell to his customers. He is responsible for managing his family’s daily expenses, and works from 9 am to 8 pm every day. Sidy would like to have another dressmaking workshop to that he can diversify his products, as well as to save money.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothes for sale.

loans.name: 04-06-02-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuyên operates a food stall/restaurant selling noodles. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Xuyên is 64 years old, and she is married, with three children.  She is the group leader of the 04-06-02-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Her children are grown up.

In 2010, Xuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Xuyên has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Xuyên hopes for her children to find good jobs; for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase rice and pork to make processed food to resell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 54 años, está casada con Pablo y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su cuñado porque sus 4 hijos ya son mayores e independientes. Carmen se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, tiene un pequeña tienda acondicionada en su casa en donde espera a sus clientes quienes van en busca de cualquier tipo de producto. Lleva haciendo éste trabajo más de 9  años, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo.
Le gusta su trabajo pues  es independiente, tiene tiempo disponible para realizar otras actividades, además de poder asistir de manera puntual y tranquila a su empleo como docente de una institución educativa de la ciudad. Este es su quinto crédito con Kiva y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500 soles, comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz azúcar, harina, huevos entre otros.
texts.en:
Carmen, 54, is married to Pablo. She lives in her own house with her husband and her brother-in-law, because her four children are already independent adults. 

Carmen sells groceries. She has a small store set up in her home where she waits for her clients, who come to her looking for all types of products. She has been in this business for nine years with the help of her husband. She likes her work because she is independent and she has free time to do other things. She also likes to go calmly and on time to her job as a teacher at an educational institution in her city. 

This is her fifth loan with Kiva, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support. She will then feel confident making progress with her business. She is also committed to paying her installments on time. With the requested amount of 1,500 Peruvian soles, she will buy food products such as rice, sugar, flour, and eggs, among others.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, sugar, flour, and eggs, among others.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 57 años de edad, está casada con Juan y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Reyna se dedica a la confección, tiene una taller pequeño pero muy bien instalado en su casa, ahí hace trabajos por encargo o hace sus propios diseños y creaciones para poder vender a sus clientes que siempre van en busca de un nuevo modelo y diseño para comprar. Lleva haciendo este trabajo desde muy joven, siempre tuvo curiosidad  y  su madre le enseño todo lo que sabe y desde ahí se decidió a trabajar en ésta actividad, y hasta el momento lo realiza  sola.Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Este es su cuarto crédito con Kiva, por tanto cuenta con su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 soles, comprará materiales para continuar con su trabajo como telas, hilos, elásticos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Reyna, 57, is married to Juan and has four children. She lives with them in her own home. 

Reyna makes clothing. She has a small but well-outfitted workshop set up in her house, where she works by order or makes her own designs and creations that she can sell to clients. They always come to her looking for a new model and design to buy. She has been in this business from a young age, since she was always curious and her mother taught her everything she knew. From there, she decided to work in this business, and so far she has worked alone. She considers her business to be profitable because of the good earnings it brings her. 

This is her fourth loan with Kiva. She is counting on this contribution to continue with her goals, and she is also committed to paying her installments on time. With the requested amount of 2,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy materials to continue with her work, such as fabric, thread, elastic, and other materials.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a 68-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be highly self-motivated. 

She operates a transportation service where she lets her tenants transport customers and packages. She has been involved in this business for more than five years. Her business is located in an area good for business, and her primary customers are local residents.  

She will use the PHP 10,000 loan to buy spare parts to service her motorbike. Her business goal is to own at least four motorbikes within five years. 

She hopes that in the near future, she will succeed in life. She has borrowed multiple loans from GDMPC. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service her motorbike

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 43 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school.  

Alma is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs.

Alma has been pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia, de 28 años esta casada con Gedeoli con quien tiene 2 hijos, juntos viven en la casa de su suegra. Lidia se dedica al negocio, pero también siembra y cría animales. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de queso de manera semanal en las ferias de las ciudades de Lima y la selva central. Le va muy bien en su negocio pues gracias a ello puede solventar los principales gastos del hogar. Ya tiene 4 años dedicándose a esto por lo que posee clientes puntuales y muy buenos, “la venta de queso es muy bueno, comercializo los moldes al doble de su precio normal, pues en la costa y en la selva no existe ese producto”, afirma.
