Ahora dese mejorar sus ingresos para poder tener más capital y así invertir más.  Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, durante este tiempo pudo obtener muchos benéficos, por ello agradece el apoyo de su asociación.
Lidia, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de más moldes de queso para su venta.
texts.en:
Lidia, 28, is married to Gedeoli with whom she has two children.  They all live together in her mother-in-laws’ house.  Lidia is a businesswoman but also raises animals and works in agriculture.  Her work consists in selling cheese weekly in the city of Lima’s street markets and in the central jungle.  She does very well in her business and thanks to it she’s able to cover her household’s main expenses.  She’s been doing this for four years so has punctual, good customers.  “Selling cheese is very good; I sell the molds at twice their normal price because this product is unavailable on the coast and in the jungle,” she affirms.

She now wants to improve her income in order to have more capital and invest more.  This is her first Kiva loan.  She was able to obtain many benefits during this time so she’s grateful for her association’s support.  Lidia will use the 1,000 soles to buy more cheese molds to sell.

loans.use: to buy cheese molds.

loans.name: 08-03-08-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Dung is 41 years old and she is married with two children. She lives with her two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Dung has a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to resell.

In 2012, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dung is the group leader of the 08-03-08-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.

In the future, Dung hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Armie

texts.en:
Armie works hard to support her family. Armie is single and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.

Armie requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like eggs, chicken, pork, vegetables, etc.

In the future, Armie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like eggs, chicken, pork, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 60 años es una mujer independiente. Vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos, a los que cuida en la casa de sus padres. Desde niña comenzó a trabajar en el campo, pero en la actualidad sus hijos la motivaron a  incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de carne de gallina en la capital. Hace 2 años que comenzó con el negocio, le va muy bien pues recibe el apoyo de su hija, quien reside en la capital del país. Su trabajo consiste en criar la gallina en un espacio amplio que acondicionó en su casa, donde las alimenta hasta que se encuentren maduras, cuando se encuentran maduras, viaja a comercializar la carne a la ciudad de Lima, donde llega una vez al mes, pues el movimiento es constante y requiere de mucho capital de trabajo. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Julia, invertirá los S/.3800 soles en la compra de varias gallinas para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia, 60, is an independent woman living in the company of her three children who she cares for in her parents’ house.  Since she was a girl she started to work in the fields but currently her children motivated her to start a business buying and selling chicken meat in the capital.  She started the business two years ago and does very well because her daughter who lives in the nation’s capital helps her.  Her work consists in raising chickens in an ample space she set aside at home to do so.  She feeds them until they mature and when they are mature she travels to Lima to sell their meat.  She goes there once a month because movement is constant and she needs much working capital.

This is her first Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she’s getting to continue forward.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  Julia will use the 3,800 soles to buy several chickens to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens at wholesale.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor, de 40 años, vive junto a su esposa Victoria y sus 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 22 años. Su tiempo lo distribuye entre 2 actividades, la agricultura y ganadería. Esta primera consiste en la siembra de papa en gran cantidad en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, los cuales comercializa a los mayoristas que llegan siempre a su mismo terreno agrícola. Pero su principal ingreso económica de manera constante consiste en la crianza de vacas lecheras, tiene un promedio de 4 vacas que le brindan leche diaria, la que vende a los intermediarios de la zona, asimismo elabora queso por temporadas, “todo depende a la cantidad de leche, si un día produce más leche aprovecho es realizar queso”, comenta. Su secreto es la buena crianza que desarrolla, sobre todo en engordar a las vacas, por lo que también se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de vacas, es decir compra vacas flacas para engordarlas y venderlas a un mayor precio, “con amor y cuidado se puede mantener a una vaca saludable”, comenta. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA,y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Héctor, invertirá los S/.3800 en la compra de 3 vacas flacas de buena calidad, para comenzar el proceso de engorde.
texts.en:
Héctor, 40, lives with his wife, Victoria, and their three children in the house he bought 22 years ago.  He divides his time into two activities: agriculture and animal husbandry.  The first consists in growing potatoes in great amounts on his own farmland.   He sells them to wholesalers who come to his farmland always.  But his main source of constant income consists in raising dairy cows.  He owns on average four cows that produce milk daily that he sells to middlemen in the zone.  He also makes cheese seasonally.  “It all depends on the amount of milk.  If more is produces on a certain day I take advantage of it to make cheese,” he comments.  His secret is the good growth he develops especially in fattening up the cows.  He’s also in the cow buying and selling business.  That is, he buys skinny cows to fatten them up and then sell them at a higher price.  “With love and care one can have a healthy cow,” he comments.  

This is his first Kiva loan and he feels grateful for the economic support he gets to continue forward.  He also commits to make his payments punctually.  Héctor will use the 3,800 soles to buy three good quality skinny cows to start the process of fattening them up.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 49 años vive en compañía de sus 4 hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres hace 35 años. Desde muy joven, aproximadamente 20 años comenzó su camino por la ganadería y agricultura, sus principales actividades económicas. Hace muy poco sufrió la muerte de su esposa, desde entonces tomo las riendas de la educación de sus hijas y su familia, sabe que tiene que luchar al doble para sacarlas adelante y no desanima con ello, al contrario es un hombre responsable y correcto. Es gobernante de su pueblo y parte de la junta directiva de su asociación. Siempre brinda el ejemplo trabajando con mucho esmero en la crianza de sus animales, posee vacas lecheras que le brindan 20 litros de leche que comercializa a los intermediarios, asimismo siembra papa en las grandes extensiones de terrenos agrícolas que heredó, junto a sus hijas trabaja sin descanso para su futuro. Ahora se encuentra preparándose para la próxima siembra de papa. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante.
Juan, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Juan, 49, lives in the company of his four children who he cares for in the house he inherited from his parents 35 years ago.  Since a very young age, approximately 20 years ago, he started his path in animal husbandry and agriculture, his main economic activities.  

A short time ago he suffered the loss of his wife and since then he’s taken over the task of educating his daughters and his family.  He knows that he must work doubly hard now to move them forward but he’s not discouraged by this.  On the contrary, he’s a responsible, decent man.  

He’s his town’s governor and a member of his association’s governing board.  He always sets an example working very hard raising his animals.  He owns dairy cows that produce 20 liters of milk that he sells to middlemen.  He also grows potatoes on large tracts of farmland that he inherited.  He works non-stop alongside his daughters to give them a future.

He’s now getting ready for the next potato planting season.  This is his first Kiva loan and he feels very grateful for the support he gets to continue forward.  Juan will use the 500 soles to buy organic manure to nourish his crop.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Edilia

texts.es:
Edilia, de 37 años, vive en compañía de su esposo con quien tiene 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 20 años. Los sembríos que posee los comercializa en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde viaja de manera constante. Comenta que cuando comenzó a formar su familia, sus padres le otorgaron los terrenos donde hoy siembra, papa, alverja y maíz, los cuales cuida todos los días, comenta que los terrenos que tiene se ubican en distintos lugares por lo que tiene que caminar horas y horas para llegar, aprovecha los pastos naturales que posee para mantener alimentadas a las vacas que posee, de las que también extrae leche de buena calidad que le brindan ingresos diarios. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.
Edilia, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Edilia, 37, lives in the company of her husband with whom she has three children she cares for in the house she bought 20 years ago.  She sells the crops she produces in the city of Huancayo where she travels to constantly.  

She comments that when she started to form her family her parents gave her the farmland where today she grows potatoes, peas and corn.  She cares for them every day and comments that the parcels of land are located in different places so she must walk for hours and hours to reach them.  She takes advantage of the natural grasses to keep the cows she owns well fed.  She gets good quality milk from them that also produces daily income.

This is her first Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue moving forward.  Edilia will use the 1,500 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: 08-03-07-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Bình is 27 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

Bình has a service business cutting hair, and has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Bình faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment for her hair cutting business.

Bình is the group leader of the 08-03-07-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. In 2012, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

With her business profit, Bình hopes to buy land of her own, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for a hair cutting business.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is a 34-year-old married woman. She has one child, who is 10 years old. She describes herself to be God-fearing. 

She operates a pharmacy, where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for three years.  Her business is located in a rural setting, and her primary customers are loyal customers.  She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of capital to expand and meet demand. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more medicine to sell.  Her business goal is to expand to a dispensary and be able to meet health needs in the area within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more medicine to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, who is 50 years old, is married, with four children.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Vilma has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spices to resell.

Vilma has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to resell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 29-year-old woman. She has two children, ages three and six years. She describes herself to be jovial. She operates a clothes stall where she sells secondhand clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are the general public. 

Lilian will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more ladies clothes for resale. Her business goal is to import clothes within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more ladies clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn lives in her own house, along with her life companion and their children. She sells a variety of goods in her store to earn a living. 

For three years, her business has been located in a zone with a lot of traffic. She is an honest and responsible person, of very good character. In addition, she has the ability to pay. Thanks to her effort, she has managed to pay many of her expenses. 

Marilyn is applying for a loan to invest in her business and be able to buy more canned goods, noodles, etc. to be able to obtain greater income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: 08-02-06-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan has a service business providing photocopies. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to do photocopying service. 

Loan is 37 years old and she is married, with two children.

Loan is the group leader of the 08-02-06-Phú Sơn2 Group which consists of eight members. She lives with two dependents and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Loan joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Loan has successfully repaid two loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Loan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Loan hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her photocopying service.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna earns a living by selling grilled chicken (or “Lechon Manok” in our dialect). She is 38 years old, married, and lives in Lawis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. 

She is now well known for the nice quality and good taste of her grilled chicken.  She has already saved from the profit of her business. Her business is self-sustaining and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 5,000 per month.  

Myrna is seeking a PHP 5,000 loan.  She would like to use the loan to purchase dressed chicken.   This is a microfinance loan and would be repaid in a few months. 

In her five previous loans, she has never had a delinquency. Myrna is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to her effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy dressed chicken

loans.name: Rowela

texts.en:
Rowela is 31 years old. She is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and two children. She is a farmer who plants rice and corn.

Rowela wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: 08-01-08-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy works in agricultural farming, poultry, and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase pigs to raise 

Thủy is 47 years old, and married with two children.
Thủy is the group leader of the 08-01-08-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2011, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her children to do well in school, family to be healthy and happy, and business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: 08-01-09-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sâm operates a food stall/restaurant selling crabs. She is requesting a loan to purchase crabs, shrimps, and fishes to resell.
Sâm is 56 years old and married with one child.

Sâm is the group leader of the 08-01-09-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2012, Sâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Sâm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Sâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship Sâm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Sâm hopes for her children to do well in school, family to be healthy and happy, and business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase crabs, shrimps, and fishes to resell.

loans.name: Ana Hazel

texts.en:
Ana Hazel works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Ana Hazel has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ana Hazel has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rasmijo

texts.en:
This is the story of Ica, daughter of Rasmijo:

I just graduated from junior high school and planned to continue my study at vocational school.  However, my parents have trouble funding that, considering the fact that our family condition is not in a good term.  My parents work as share-croppers with no stable income. I always think over and over about how I can continue my study without giving them more trouble. I hope that by joining Kiva, I’ll be able to keep on studying and make my future dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old and married, with five children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more items to sell, like snack foods, shampoo, liquor, and other groceries.

She has been running the general store for 18 years. Marilyn aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like snack foods, shampoo, liquor, and other groceries.

loans.name: 01.01.18 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Huệ is applying for a loan to purchase fruit to resell . She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit.  Huệ has been involved in this business for five years.

Huệ is 45 years old, and she is married with two children.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Huệ is the group leader of the 02.01.18 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of eight members. 

In 2005, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  Huệ has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concern her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk ("solterita" cookies and cream)

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es: Ana, con 58 años de edad, es separada y madre de 3 hijos. Desde hace 43 años, aprendió todo lo relacionado con la confección, tomando cursos en diferentes entidades, pues siempre le ha gustado mucho todo lo relacionado con las manualidades, además en esa época, era muy común que las mujeres se desempeñaran en esa labor. Durante su vida productiva trabajó en varios talleres de confección, pero cuando a uno de sus hijos le diagnosticaron una seria enfermedad, ella decidió independizarse  y montó el taller de confección en la casa donde reside, para estar al cuidado de su hijo y de su madre de 85 años de edad. Tristemente su hijo ya falleció pero, con el apoyo de su familia ha sabido llevar su dolor y ha seguido adelante. Actualmente su principal clientela son empresas que la contratan para sacar diversas producciones, trabaja largas jornadas iniciando desde las 7:00 am y hasta altas horas de la noche, dependiendo de la cantidad de trabajo que tenga, para cumplir con los pedidos a tiempo. Ana solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una máquina fileteadora y terminar de cancelar una máquina plana que compró a cuotas; con esto aumentará su capacidad instalada para mejorar los tiempos de producción y agilizar el proceso, lo que le ayudará a entregar los pedidos oportunamente, así podrá abrir las posibilidades de incrementar su clientela y por ende los ingresos, con los cuales podrá continuar solventando las necesidades básicas del hogar. Ana, con su espíritu emprendedor, motivada por su familia y con el ánimo de seguir progresando, lucha incansablemente para cumplir el sueño de ampliar su taller, en el que pueda generar más empleo y aumentar sus ventas, para que, en un futuro a mediano plazo pueda adquirir su casa propia y brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 58, is separated and is a mother of three children. For 43 years, she has learned everything related to sewing, taking courses at different institutions, because she has always liked everything to do with handicrafts. Also in that time, it was very common for women to carry out that kind of work. During her working life, she worked in various sewing shops, but when one of her children was diagnosed with a serious illness, she decided to become independent and started the workshop in the house where she lives, in order to care for her child and her mother, who is 85. Sadly, her son passed away, but with the support of her family, she has been able to manage her pain and move forward. 

Currently, her main customers are businesses who hire her to make diverse products. She works long days, starting at 7:00 am and into the wee hours of the night, depending on the amount of work she has, in order to complete the orders on time. Ana is asking for the loan to buy a serger and finish paying off a tabletop machine that she was buying in installments. With this, she will improve her installed capacity to improve her production times and speed up the process, which will help her turn in her orders quickly. She will have the possibility of increasing her customer base and therefore her income, with which she can continue meeting her household expenses.  Ana, with her entrepreneurial spirit, motivated by her family and with the enthusiasm to keep moving forward, fights tirelessly to achieve her dream of expanding her workshop, so that she can create more jobs and increase her sales. This way, in the medium term, she can buy her own house and give her family greater comfort and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a serger and to pay off a tabletop sewing machine that she was paying off in installments

loans.name: Angel Mae

texts.en:
Angel Mae is 18 years old, single, and works very hard to help her parents.

Angel Mae runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell, such as soap, milk, coffee, canned goods, etc.

Angel Mae has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Angel Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as soap, milk, coffee, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Manuel Concepcion

texts.es:
El socio Manuel se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,el socio prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,el socio tambien vende chicha de jora y frutillada,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.El socio solicita el credito para comprar arroz,pollo y verduras para el restaurant.

El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Manuel continues to be dedicated to the business of the restaurant. He prepares breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. He also sells chicha de jora (a traditional Peruvian beverage) and frutillada (a blend of chicha and strawberries). He has worked in this business for many years. His dream is to expand the restaurant. He is requesting the loan to purchase rice, chicken, and vegetables for the restaurant. 

He feels grateful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling the payment installments.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, and vegetables for the restaurant.

loans.name: Blanca Ibonne

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer de 62 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos. Desde hace 25 años se dedica a la confección, actividad que aprendió realizando cursos en diferentes entidades, luego comenzó a laborar en varias empresas de confección desempeñándose como operaria, labor que realizó durante 24 años, ya que, debido a su edad, ya no la contrataban y por ello, desde hace un año montó su propio taller donde presta los servicios de confección y modistería, de esta manera ha logrado generar los ingresos para el sustento familiar. La cliente es una señora que se caracteriza por su amabilidad y dedicación a su labor, es responsable y trabajadora, le gusta lo que hace y día a día se esfuerza para continuar con su negocio. Esto la motiva a solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, elásticos, encajes) y realizar mantenimiento a sus máquinas, de esta forma tendrá más variedad de materia prima disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorará el tiempo de producción ya que sus máquinas trabajarán adecuadamente; todo esto se reflejará en el incremento de sus ventas y por ende los ingresos que recibe. Blanca sueña con tener un taller de confección más amplio, con mejor maquinaria y así ofrecer oportunidades de empleo a madres cabeza de hogar, de esta forma mejorará no sólo la calidad de vida de su familia, sino también la de otras personas que influyan en todo este proceso y, en un futuro cercano poder disfrutar de los frutos de su arduo trabajo.
texts.en:
Blanca, 62, is a single mother of two children. For 25 years, she has worked as a tailor. She learned this skill by taking classes from different organizations and then she started working at various tailoring businesses as an operator. She did this work for 24 years until they didn't hire her due to her age. A year ago, she set up her own workshop where she provides tailoring and dressmaking services. This has allowed her to earn income to take care of her family.

Blanca is a kind woman who is dedicated to her work. She is responsible, hard-working, and likes what she does. Every day, she works to move forward with her business. She is requesting this loan to buy wholesale products (fabric, thread, elastic, lace) and to perform maintenance on her machines. This will allow her to have a greater variety of materials to offer her customers and it will improve her production because the machines will work well. All of this will be reflected in increased sales and, ultimately, the income she receives.

Blanca dreams of having a larger tailoring workshop with better machinery so she can offer employment opportunities to mothers who are heads of households. This means she will not only improve her family's quality of life, but also that of others who are affected by this process and who, in the near future, will enjoy the fruits of her labor.

loans.use: to buy wholesale products (fabric, thread, elastic, lace) and to perform maintenance on her machines

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD - CCACHIMAYO, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luz Marina tiene 34 años de edad es casada y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: This is a member of the Solidaridad - Cachimayo communal bank. The bank is located in the department of Cusco. Luz Marina, 34, is married and has one son. She alternates her daily activities with a business raising small animals like guinea pigs. She has been in this business for awhile, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She raises these small animals and then sells them to customers who ask for them. She is applying for this loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. She is grateful for the loan provided and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 50 years old and married, with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elisa has a general store business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, spices, soft drinks, chips, etc.

Elisa has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, spices, soft drinks, chips, etc.

loans.name: Atanacia

texts.en:
Atanacia is 60 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Atanacia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, chips, bread, etc.

Atanacia has been in this business for 28 years.

In the future Atanacia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: 03.01.09 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ operates a food stall/restaurant selling beverage. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain the refreshment bar (Small bar with coffee, tea, soft drink, fast food…).

Huệ is 59 years old and she is married with 2 children.
She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 03.01.09- Quảng Hưng solidarity group. 
Hue's children are grown up so Huệ lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Huệ has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Huệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Huệ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase materials to maintain the refreshment bar (Small bar with coffee, tea, soft drink, fast food…).

loans.name: Denisse Valeria

texts.es: La Señorita Denisse es estudiante de la carrera de Auditoria en una universidad de la Ciudad de La Paz, ella tiene 19 años de edad, desde muy pequeña mostro inclinaciones a los números por este motivo decidió estudiar auditoria, ella no trabaja ya que sus papas pagaban sus gastos de estudio, pero ella decidió sacar crédito en la institución para pagar sus gastos de educación como matricula, útiles y gastos de transporte  Y desea poder encontrar un trabajo aunque de medio tiempo ´parea poder pagar sus cuotas y así no darle más trabajo a sus papas, ella es una joven responsable su único deseo es poder salir profesional y ejercer su profesión y así ayudar a sus padres a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Denisse is studying a degree in Auditing at a university in the city of La Paz. She is 19 years old. From the time she was young, she showed an affinity for numbers, so she decided to study auditing. She did not work since her parents paid her school expenses. But she decided to take out a loan with the institution in order to pay her school expenses, like tuition, supplies, and transportation expenses. She also wants to find a part-time job to be able to make payments and not give more work to her parents. She is a responsible young woman. Her only wish is to become a professional and pursue her profession and help her parents improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to pay tuition and higher education costs

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Née en 1980 à FANA, KADIATOU vit avec ses 6 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire dans la commune rurale de Ouelessebougou. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite KADIATOU s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus. Elle est à son premier prêt individuel destiné à la constitution de stock de condiments et denrées alimentaires pour la vente. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine à Bamako et compte avoir avec ce prêt 60  kilogrammes de condiments et des tubercules. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les échéances du prêt et investir dans ses affaires.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Fana, Kadiatou lives in a rural community in Oelesselbougou.with her husband and six children in a nuclear family Not having had a chance to advance in her studies, Kadiatou started earning a living early on. She is on her first individual loan intended for stocking up on condiments and food staples for sale. She stocks up once a week in Bamako. With this loan, she plans to buy 60 kg [132 lbs] of condiments and yams.
She hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 20,000 West African francs, which will be used to repay her loan and invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 49 years old, a widowed mother of 3 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mary Ann has a fish selling business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Mary Ann has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Beymar

texts.es:
Beymar vive en la ciudad de La Paz en una casa de ladrillo con su familia.

Beymar se dedica al diseño grafico de portadas, afiches, volantes, trípticos, etc. Beymar esta solicitando el crédito para poder terminar sus estudios en la universidad.


El sueño de Beymar es poder completar sus estudios en la universidad para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Beymar lives in the city of Paz in a brick house with his family. 

He studies graphic design of covers, posters, flyers, brochures, and more. Beymar is requesting a loan so he can finish his university education. Beymar's dream is to complete his university degree so he can provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for a Graphic Design degree

loans.name: 03.08.09 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Châu works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Châu is 54 years old, and she is married with 2 children. Châu is the group leader of the 03.08.09 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Her children are grown up so Châu lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Châu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Châu has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Châu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Châu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Châu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like tailoring chalk, cloth, etc for her tailoring business.

Lilia has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like tailoring chalk, cloth, etc for her tailoring business

loans.name: El Poder Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de amigos formaron el banco comunal “El Poder” en la ciudad del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios  son profesionales y otros venden productos de belleza y nutricionales. 

Martha nació en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y tiene 39 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos nutricionales y vende a sus amigos, vecinos y familiares entonces ella es una persona responsable y sus amigos no dudaron en invitarle a participar del banco comunal. En esta oportunidad Martha requiere el préstamo para comprar  más suplementos alimenticios. (En la parte inferior de la foto aparece uno de los socios que pidió permiso para no estar presente en la reunión)
texts.en:
A group of friends formed the El Poder communal bank in the city of Cusco. This communal bank is made up of several people who are always looking for opportunities to move forward and through their daily effort, give their children a better future. The members are professionals and others sell beauty and nutrition products. Martha was born in the beautiful city of Cusco and is 39 years old. She is married and has two children as a result of this wonderful relationship. She works selling nutritional products and she sells to her friends, neighbors, and family members. She is a responsible person and her friends had no doubts about inviting her to be part of their communal bank. On this occasion, Martha needs a loan to buy more 
nutritional supplements. (At the bottom of the photo is a picture of one of the members who asked permission to not be present at the meeting.)

loans.use: to buy more nutritional supplements.

loans.name: 03.01.42 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyên operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetable and resell.

Tuyên is 59 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Tuyên is the group leader of the 03.01.42- Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
Tuyen children are grown up so Tuyên lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Tuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tuyên has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Tuyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main harship that Tuyên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyên hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and resell.

loans.name: Daniel Emmanuel

texts.es:
Daniel, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar más mercadería, tales como: analgésicos, vitaminas, capsulas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le permitió mejorar su negocio, aumento las ventas y asimismo su clientela; es por ello que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han estabilizado.
texts.en:
Daniel needs to request another loan because he is in need of more working capital to continue his business. This investment will help him buy more merchandise such as painkillers, vitamins, capsules, and other items.

His previous loan allowed him to improve his business by increasing sales and customers. Because of this, his economic condition and family circumstances have stabilized.

loans.use: to buy painkillers, vitamins, capsules, and other items.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 47 years old.

She is the mother of two daughters and three sons. Her two sons are doing different types of jobs and one of them is studying. One of her daughters is married and one is living with her. 

Her husband has owned a vegetable shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal vegetables to his customers. He opens his shop early in the morning and closes in the evening. Nowadays he sells out of all of the vegetables very early in the day. He wants to increase his available stock on a daily basis so that he can sell the maximum number of vegetables each day and gain the maximum reward for his efforts. 

Therefore, Rehana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy more seasonal vegetables than in the past.

Rehana says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in large quantites to sell.

loans.name: Leticia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Leticia, le surge el requerimiento de adquirir un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar variedad de mercadería, tales como: harina, azúcar, leña, levadura, huevos, entre otros.
Comenta la Sra. Leticia que el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios, crecer su clientela y asimismo obtuvo mejores ingresos. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en: Leticia needs to get another loan because she needs more working capital to continue her business. This investment will help her to buy a variety of merchandise, like flour, sugar, firewood, yeast, and eggs, among other things. Leticia says that the previous credit helped her to increase her inventory, and grow her customer base, and she also earned more income. The economic conditions and family circumstances have been optimized.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, firewood, yeast, and eggs, among other things.

loans.name: Hyacinthe Antoine

texts.fr: Hyacinthe est camerounais de 54 ans. père de 05 enfant dont le plus âgé a 26 ans et le moins âgé 05 ans, il possède un atelier de couture depuis près de 31 ans dans un quartier de la ville. ayant reçu une forte commande de tenues scolaires, il souhaite avec le crédit acheter les rouleaux de tissus afin de réaliser les commandes reçus. les bénéfices obtenus seront réinvestis dans l'activité, permettront entre autres de rembourser le crédit et d'assurer l'avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en: Hyacinthe is a 54-year-old man from Cameroon.  He is the father of five children whose ages range from 26 years old to 5 years old.  He has run a sewing shop, in one of the neighborhoods of his city, for the past 31 years.  He has just received a large order for school uniforms and would like to use his loan to buy rolls of fabrics, so that he can fulfill his orders.  Part of his profits will be reinvested in his business while the rest will be used to repay his loan and ensure that his children have a good future.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Jenifer Andrea

texts.es: Jenifer a sus 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Actualmente se encuentra desempleada debido a su inexperiencia en el campo laboral, por lo que le ha sido difícil encontrar oportunidades de empleo; esto la lleva a iniciar su propio negocio, con el fin de generar los ingresos necesarios para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Desea montar un almacén de venta de calzado y ropa para dama, mercancía que proviene de China, lo que le generará mayor rotación y una buena rentabilidad.  Los conocimientos que posee en el área comercial, los obtuvo de sus padres, quienes han trabajado la mayor parte de su vida como independientes y tienen un negocio de venta de ropa usada en una de las plazas principales de la ciudad. La cliente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (calzado, tennis, blusas, jeans para dama) con lo cual pretende dar inicio a su proyecto y así comenzar a generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar, además tendrá la posibilidad de generar empleo para otras personas. De esta manera, Jenifer desea luchar para alcanzar el sueño de ampliar su negocio, abrir más sucursales en diferentes lugares de la ciudad y en un futuro, poder viajar a diferentes países del mundo que se destaquen por la producción textil como China, Los Ángeles y New York; pero es consciente que para lograrlo debe esforzarse y trabajar con mucho empeño y dedicación.
texts.en:
Jenifer is 22 years old, and lives in a common-law marriage. Currently she is unemployed due to her lack of work experience, and it has been difficult for her to find employment opportunities. This brings her to start her own business, with the goal of generating the necessary income to support her home. 

She wants to start a store that sells shoes and clothing for women, merchandise that comes from China, which will generate better turnover of stock and good profitability. She obtained the knowledge that she has in business from her parents, who have worked the larger part of their lives independently, and have a store that sells used clothing on one of the principal plazas in the city. 

She is requesting the loan with the goal of investing it in the purchase of merchandise in bulk (shoes, tennis shoes, blouses, women's jeans), with which she hopes will give a start to her project and in that way start to generate the sufficient resources to support her husband with the economics of the home, and additional that she will have the possibility of generating employment for other people. 

In this way, Jenifer wishes to fight to achieve her dream of expanding her business, opening more branches in different parts of the city, and in the future, to be able to travel to different countries of the world that stand out for textile production like China, Los Angeles, and New York; but she is conscious that to achieve it she should work hard and put forth effort with much determination and dedication.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk (shoes, tennis shoes, blouses, women's jeans).

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela is 48 and the mother of four children. She is taking a loan for her elder son who wants to buy leather jackets to sell in the winter season. Her elder son has already owned a garment shop for many years. As we know, the winter season is going to start in Pakistan and the cost of leather jackets will double. He wants to buy leather jackets very soon at cheap rates so that he could earn a maximum profit in the winter season.

Therefore, Jameela requested a loan for her son from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Jameela hopes that her son will utilize this amount in positive ways. She says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy leather jackets to sell in the winter season.

loans.name: Maelewano Zomboko Group

texts.en:
Fatuma runs a business selling new clothes of different kinds. She is from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She is married and is now in her late 30s. 

Fatuma starts working from 10am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good return per month.  This is her first credit request, which she will use to buy stocks of bags, sarongs and other clothes to resell. She is doing great in her business.  She dreams of owning a nice family house. 

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group "Maelewano Zomboko" which has 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell

loans.name: 04-05-04-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Thủy is 34 years old and is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 04-05-04-Nam Ngạn solidarity group. Thủy lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thủy has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase fabrics to do clothes tailoring. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2010, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thủy hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: buy fabrics for her tailor business

loans.name: Elizabeth Wanjiku

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old and is from Nakuru. She is married to Samuel, who works as a civil servant to produce additional income for the family. Elizabeth  has three children aged 16, 13 and 8 years old, all of whom are in school.

Elizabeth is a dairy farmer, a business she has been operating for the past five years.  To enable her be more productive in this sector, she has applied for her second loan of KSH 100,000 from Kadet ltd, which she is going to use for buying animal feeds and medicine for her livestock.  Her monthly income right now is KSH 14,000 and she hopes to use the anticipated profit from the expanded business to start poultry farming.

Elizabeth's hopes and dreams for the future is to be the leading livestock farmer in her region, and for her family to be financially stable.

loans.use: buy feed and medicine for her livestock

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
This is Carmen. Her previous loan was a big help in her business, as she was able to buy the needed products for her variety store. She used her income from the business for her household's everyday expenses.  Carmen has been running her variety store for five years now. She and her husband are helping each other to provide for their everyday needs.

Carmen would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carmen dreams that her business will be more successful and hopes to have a good life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cows to resell

loans.name: Nairoshi

texts.en:
Nairoshi is 37 years old and is from Nakuru. She is married and her spouse assists her with her farm work.  They have nine children aged 17, 15, 13, 11, 9, 7, 5, 3 and 2 years old.

Nairoshi is a farmer, a business she has been carrying out for the last 13 years.  She has applied for her second loan of KSH 70,000 from Kadet Ltd so as to enable her to buy fertilizers, herbicides, planting seeds and to also hire laborers who will assist her in farm work.

Her monthly income at present is KSH 20,000 and she plans to use profits from her expanded business to educate her children. In the future, Nairoshi hopes to buy a plot of land within her town.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Irene is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to sell for her fruit vending business.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: buy fruit to resell

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en el cultivo de maíz y frijol; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los materiales agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros. 
Comenta el Sr. armando que el crédito anterior le permitió adquirir los insumos agrícolas y con ello logro garantizar la alimentación de su familia, ya que su sueño es siempre apoyar sus hijos en los estudios y que no les haga falta nada.
texts.en:
Armando has to apply for a new loan because he needs more working capital to continue cultivating corn and beans. This investment will help him to buy farming materials such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, pest controls and insecticides among others.

Sr. Armando notes that his former loan enabled him to buy agricultural supplies so that he could feed his family since his goal is always to support his children in their studies and to see to it that they have what they need.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, pest controls and insecticides, among others.

loans.name: Ana Marleny

texts.es:
Ana, vive junto con su esposo y no tiene hijos, asimismo no posee familiares en el extranjero. Ella, se dedica a la agricultura, cultivo de granos básicos, tales como: maíz y frijol, también a la crianza de cerdos, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 20 años y lo aprendió de sus padres, lo desempeña todos los realizados de 6:00am a 3:00pm y hasta el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar todos los materiales de una sola vez y de esta manera asegurar el cultivo.
Su sueño es apoyar a su familia con los gastos económicos y continuar cultivando la tierra.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband.  She has no children and no family living abroad.  She makes her living in agriculture, growing basic grains likes corn and beans.  Ana also raises pigs.  She has been in this line of work, which she learned from her parents, for twenty years.  She works every day from 6:00am to 3:00pm and up until now has had no problems. 
The loan that Ana is requesting will allow her to purchase agricultural supplies, like compost, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and other items.  This investment will help her to purchase all her supplies at once, which will ensure a good crop. 
Ana's dream is to support her family financially and to continue cultivating the land.

loans.use: to purchase compost, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and other items.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar en el cultivo de granos básicos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar lo insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.  
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los materiales agrícolas y de esta manera garantizo la alimentación de su familia. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: José has been presented with the necessity of opting for a new loan because he needs more working capital in order to continue in the cultivation of basic grains. This investment will help him to purchase agricultural supplies like fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, among others. The previous loan helped him to acquire the agricultural materials and in this way guaranteed the feeding of his family. The economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, among others.

loans.name: Sr De Coyllority Picchu Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITY PICCHU”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margarita Stefany ella es conviviente y tiene 23 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de costurera, la socia cose diferentes ropas como pantalones, faldas, blusas y ternos, la socia también trabaja como controladora de carro de servicio urbano, la socia ya tiene varios años en el negocio de costurera, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de confección. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar telas de colores y botones.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se le tomo deepues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de transporte.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Sr De Coyllority Picchu communal bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department. 

A member is Margarita Stefany. She is in a common-law marriage, is 23 years old, and has 1 son. She works in her business as a seamstress. She sews different clothes like pants, skirts, blouses, and suits. She also works as a supervisor of an urban car service. She has worked various years in the seamstress business. Her dream is to have a dressmaking store. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase colorful fabrics and buttons. 

The members who are pasted onto the group photo had their pictures taken after the group photo, because they asked for permission for work reasons. The member who is covered with a circle on her face no longer belongs to the community bank. 

The other members work in a food-selling business, taxi service business, grocery store, and transportation company. 
      
The member is thankful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and is committed to making her payments in the established plan.

loans.use: to buy colorful fabrics and buttons.

loans.name: 04-06-04-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hương is 29 years old and is married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the 04-06-04-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. Hương lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hương has a retail business selling clothes.  She has been involved in this business for 3 years.   The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hương is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to resell.   This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  With her business profit, Hương hopes to buy land of her own, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 50 years old.  She is widow with six children, four of whom are in school.  Alircia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a direct sales business selling personal collections in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of personal collection products to sell.   Alicia has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy personal products to resell

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
Vangie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for two years.  Vangie is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF in order to buy purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

Vangie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Laarni is 37 years old and her three children are in school.

Laarni has a business in the Philippines direct selling Avon products. Laarni requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of Avon products like lotion, perfume, shirts, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Laarni has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon products like lotion, perfume, shirts, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is taking a loan to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors for embroidery at home. She has been knitting embroidery for many years while raising her children. She is a responsible mother. She knows about her duties and responsibilities very well. She always keeps busy and is ready to provide better facilities to her dear children.

Nabeela is 39 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her husband works in a grocery firm and comes home very late at night. She picks up and drops off her children at school and stays home alone. 

Nabeela’s dream is to purchase a new house in an established neighborhood. Therefore, she is saving part of her earnings. 

Nabeela is very happy and relaxed after taking this loan because this loan will help to increase her monthly income and savings as well.

loans.use: To buy threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors for embroidery.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 24 years old and has three children, two of whom in school.

Rebecca is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds.

Rebecca has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru:
Саломат мать одиночка. Она сама ведет хозяйство. У нее при доме имеется орошаемый участок земли, где она выращивает кукурузу. Саломат еще работает сторожем в ночное время. Она получает небольшую зарплату. Ей 57 лет, она живет в районе Спитамен. Каждое утро рано вставая Саломат идет к скотному двору, доить единственную корову. Так начинается ее утро. Обращаться с животными ее научил отец. Этот урок пригодился ей в жизни. Саломат каждый день продает по 6 литров молока. В этом ей помогают невестки и дочь. 
Саломат мать пятерых детей. У нее четыре сына и дочка. Ее сыновья находятся на заработках заграницей. 
Саломат берет кредит на сумму 3 000 долларов США для закупа коровы и бычков. Саломат намерена увеличить количество скотов на своем скотном дворе. Она надеется на вашу доброту. Спасибо!
texts.en:
Salomat is a single mother who manages her farming business on her own.  Next to her house she owns an irrigated plot of land where she grows corn.  At night, she also works as a custodian.  She makes a small income.  She is 57 years old and lives in the Spitamen district.

This is how she starts her day: she wakes up early every morning and goes to her farmyard to milk her only cow.  Her father taught her how to take care of animals, a lesson which has come in handy all her life.  With the help of her daughter and daughters-in-law, she sells about six liters of milk every day. 

Salomat is the mother of five children (four sons and one daughter).  Her sons are currently working abroad.

Salomat is taking a loan of 3,000 USD to buy some cows and young bulls.  She intends to increase her farm's cattle headcount.  She is relying on your kindness.  Thank you!

loans.use: to buy some cows and young bulls in order to increase her cattle headcount.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tires for her car.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: La Sra. Estela tiene 38 años, casada y tiene 5 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella  se dedica a la venta de comida  en su puesto fijo que se encuentra en la zona de plan 3000, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Estela va a usar este préstamo para Invertir en la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de unos ambientes en su casita, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital, la Sra. Estela enfrenta retos en su negocio ya que los  precios han subido y muchas veces los insumos  escasean y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos, para la elaboración de sus comidas, la Sra. Estela es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo  brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Estela is 38 years old, married and has five children who are school aged. She sells food at a stall in the plan 3000 area. This loan is her first from Emprender. She is going to use this loan to purchase building materials for the construction of some rooms in her house. The reason she is applying for a loan is a lack of capital.

Sra. Estela confronts challenges in her business because prices have risen and many times supplies are scare and she has to use business profits to continue buying supplies so that she can prepare her dishes. She is a very hardworking person and is happy with and grateful to Emprender for this help.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for house construction.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is the age of 37, and lives with her 5 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a mobile shop for 7 years and earns sufficient income. Her husband troubleshoots the mobile problems, sells mobile accessories such as charger, body, data cable, etc., and provides the recharge facilities of different networks. Nowadays there is an increase in demand for accessories and for recharge; sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest into the business because he spends his all income over household expenses. 

Therefore, Nighat requested a loan for her husband so that he could be empowered to buy additional accessories and extra credit for the recharge facility. Nighat says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner over this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy mobile accessories such as body, charger, handsfree, batteries and credit for recharge.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is 45 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. 

For this reason, Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation service to his passengers. Allah Rakhi is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Allah Rakhi says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain an Auto Rickshaw.

loans.name: Rigo Osmi

texts.es: Don Rigo, tiene 60 años de edad, está casado, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Hace  3 años se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser galletas, dulces, refrescos, churros etc. Don Rigo, ha invertido dos prestamos anteriores  a su negocio actualmente solicita el tercero que es por 21,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de más productos para el negocio como refrescos, dulces, churros, galletas, y otros, con el propósito de  aumentar las venta ya que tendrá más productos en el negocio. Su meta es establecer su negocio en un local fijo y obtener mejores ganancias para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rigo is sixty years old.  He is married, has four children, and lives in a village in the municipality of Azacualpa, in the department of Santa Bárbara.  For three years, he has made a living selling snacks, like cookies, sweets, refreshments, fritters, etc.  Rigo has invested two previous loans in his business, and he is presently requesting a third loan for 21,000 Lempiras.  

He will invest in the purchase of more products for his business, like refreshments, sweets, fritters, cookies, and other items.  He wants to increase his sales since he will have more products to stock his business.

His goal is to set up his business on permanent premises and to make better profits so that he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products, like cookies, gum, fritters, chocolates, refreshments, etc. to stock his business.

loans.name: Mikayel

texts.en:
Mikayel is 28 years old, and he lives in the city of Spitak, which is in the Lori region. Mikayel has graduated from Yerevan State Agricultural University, the department of Agricultural Economics. Mikayel is married, and he lives with his wife, mother and newborn son in a very nice house. His father is in the Russian Federation working abroad.  Mikayel works at the bank as a jeweler and at the same time he is seriously engaged in bee keeping. Right near his house he has a small space where he has placed his fifteen beehives. With the profit from his beekeeping, Mikayel meets his family's needs.

Mikayel asks for a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams to add to the number of beehives and to repair the road which leads to the entrance of his house and to repair their house's balcony.

loans.use: To purchase more bees and to repair the road which leads to the entrance of his house and the house's balcony

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 36 años, vive en compañía de su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Como buen hijo del campo, él se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, maíz, habas y alverja, los cuales siembra en los terrenos que heredó de sus padres, además de unos nuevos que compró gracias a su trabajo. Afirma ser una persona responsable pues mantiene los ingresos de sus actividades de manera separada, los de la agricultura y ganadería muy aparte, comenta que posee gran cantidad de vacas y toros los cuales comercializa de manera constante cada 6 meses de acuerdo al tiempo de madures y las vacas le proporcionan leche todos los días. Ahora él desea mejorar sus sembríos, para esta temporada donde los precios serán buenos. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Carlos, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in the house that they own. Like a good son of the countryside, he earns his living in farming and livestock production. His principal crops are potatoes, corn, broad beans, and peas; he grows them on the land that he inherited from his parents in addition to some new fields that he bought through his hard work. He says that he is a responsible person because he keeps the income from his business activities separated, especially what he earns from farming and from livestock. He mentions that he has a large number of cows and bulls that he is always selling every six months according to timing of their maturity; the cows provide him with milk every day. 

Now Carlos would like to improve his crops for this season, when prices will be good. This is his first loan with Kiva, and he feels grateful for the financial support that he is receiving so that he can forge ahead. In addition, he promises to make his payments punctually. 

Carlos will invest the 1,000 soles [PEN] in the purchase of organic soil amendments to fertilize his crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is from Nakuru and he is 30 years old; his spouse, Eunice, is a farmer; and he has four children aged 8, 6, 3 and 1 year old.

He is in the business of selling firewood; his business has been in operation for the past 2 years. To enable him to supply enough of this commodity to his customers he has applied for his second loan of KES 30,000 from Kadet Ltd which he is going to use for hiring more laborers to assist him with gathering and delivery.

His monthly income right now is KES 15,000 and he intends to use profits realized from his extended business for educating his children.

In the future, Patrick hopes to buy a motorcycle or a pickup to make transport of firewood efficient and effective.

loans.use: To hire more laborers to assist him with collection/gathering firewood

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Del Rey Group

texts.es:
DUO MUJERES DEL REY
El dúo está integrado por doña María  de 60 años de edad, es una mujer casada y ya no tiene hijos viviendo con ella, ella tiene una venta de tortillas desde hace mas de 40 años, y está solicitando este crédito porque necesita comprar maíz por quintal y también leña ya que ella tortea en comal de barro y sus clientes la prefieren por eso,al comprar por mayor la leña y el maiz su valor es favorable y por lo tanto sus ganancias serán mejores, por eso quiere que Fape/Kiva la ayude ya que no quiere dejar de trabajar, porque por medio de su negocio ella a podido salir adelante y tener nuevas oportunidades que antes no tenia.
texts.en:
DUO MUJERES DEL REY
This duo includes María, 60, who is married and has no children living with her. She has sold tortillas for more than 40 years, and she is asking for this loan because she needs to buy quintals of corn. She also needs to buy firewood since she makes the tortillas in a clay comal (a traditional type of griddle) and her customers prefer her for this reason. It is advantageous to buy the wood and corn wholesale, and so her profits will be better. She is why she wants Fape/Kiva to help her. She does not want to stop working, because through her business, she has been able to move forward and have new opportunities that she didn't have before.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make and sell tortillas

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 60 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cecelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, chips, spics, and bread.

Cecelia has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Cecelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, chips, spices, and bread.

loans.name: Komal

texts.en:
Komal is a 36-year-old married lady. For the past year, she has been embroidering and selling cloth. She was introduced to this business by her brother who is in the same business. Komal buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then, after adding beautiful embroidery patterns, sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough money. 

Komal is requesting a loan to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family. Komal is in her second loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes that her increased inventory will increase her income. Komal says thank-you to Kiva and to its field partner.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Badiya

texts.ru:
Бадия- бизнес woman. На вид хрупкая женщина, но на самом деле сильная и смелая. Женщина, которая сумела добиться всего сама. Бадия во второй раз кредитуется в Хумо. Первый заем она получила для покупки сухофруктов для продажи. В тот момент ее поддержали кредиторы KIVA. Она очень благодарна им. Бадия увеличила оборот. На сегодняшний день она занимается оптовой торговлей кураги. 
У Бадии одна единственная дочь, она для них мотивация для прогресса, она луч солнца ради которой они живут. Бадия продолжает свой бизнес. В очередной раз Бадия берет кредит для покупки кураги, чтобы еще больше расширить свой бизнес. Она очень надеется, что и в этот раз ее поддержат и помогут ей. Она заранее благодарит всех!
texts.en:
