Badiya is a business woman.  She may look fragile but she is actually quite strong and courageous.  She is a woman who was able to achieve everything by herself.  It is the second time that she is taking a loan with HUMO and Partners.  She used her first loan to buy dried fruits for resale.  For her first loan she received the support of Kiva lenders and wishes to thank them.  Badiya managed to increase her turnover.  She is now involved in buying and selling dried apricots in bulk quantities.

Badiya only has one daughter.  Her daughter is her motivation to succeed, for both of them.  She is her sunshine, her reason for living.  Badiya is still working at her business.  This time, she is taking a loan to buy dried apricots, in order to further grow her business.  She is really hoping to receive some help and support again.  She thanks everyone in advance!

loans.use: to buy dried apricots to be resold in bulk quantities.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 48-year-old married lady with grown up children. She is a maize farmer in the Naituyapaki area of Narok county, Kenya, and she has been in farming for the past 16 years. Her monthly income is KES 20,000 and with this loan she will purchase planting seedlings and pay for tractor charges.
She intends to use the anticipated profits to expand her farm. Her dream is to own her own farm machinery.

loans.use: to purchase planting seedlings

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 42 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Ignacio y sus 4 hijos a los que cuida en la casa de sus padres.  La actividad económica de Juana, se centra en la crianza de animales como vacas y toros, “también tengo ovejas pero en menor cantidad, me sirven para el consumo”, menciona. Ya tiene 20 años de experiencia en este negocio, el cual se intensificó cuando formó su familia. Su trabajo consiste en la compra y reproducción de los animales, los que posteriormente los cría y engorda durante 6 meses promedio, cuando se encuentren maduros, los comercializa en la feria que se desarrolla, los días domingos en la ciudad. Su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pues tiene que sembrar alfalfa para alimentarlos y cuidarlos, sobre todo por ser vacas y toros, “pero recibo el apoyo de mis hijos”, comenta. Ahora planea incrementar su ganado, por lo que comprará un toro para reproducción. Además de comenzar la siembra de alverja, pues ya tiene los terrenos preparados. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Juana, invertirá los S/.3500 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos y obtener el alimento para sus animales.
texts.en:
Juana is an unpretentious 42-year-old woman. She lives with her husband Ignacio and their four children, whom she cares for in her parents' house. 

Juana's economic activity is centered around raising animals like cows and bulls. "I also have sheep, but in smaller numbers; they are for personal consumption," she explains. She already has 20 years of experience in this business, which intensified when she started her family. Her work consists of buying and breeding the animals, which she then raises and fattens for an average of six months until they reach maturity; then she sells them in the market that takes place on Sundays in her city. Her work is very demanding, because she has to grow alfalfa to feed them and take care of them, especially the cows and bulls, "...but I have my children's help," she says. 

Now, Juana is planning to increase her livestock, so she bought a breeding bull. In addition, she is starting to plant peas, as she already has the fields prepared. This is her first loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she is receiving so that she can progress. In addition, she promises to make her payments punctually. 

Juana will invest the 3,500 soles (PEN) in the purchase of organic soil amendments to fertilize her crops and produce feed for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to grow alfalfa.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Doña Zoila es originaria de san Martin Jilotepeque, de 47 años, viuda y madre de tres hijas. Doña Zoila desde hace más de 11 años se dedica a la elaboración de bordados y tejidos típicos en los cuales ha encontrado una fuente de ingresos para su familia, como trabajo secundario se dedica a la crianza de pollos. su sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijas y poder tener ingresos para darles estudio. este es el segundo crédito kiva que solicita en el primero fue muy puntual para depositar durante todo el año solo tuvo tres días de atraso. Agradece a Fape y kiva el apoyo que le brindan. Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos y concentrado para pollos.
texts.en: Zoila is from San Martin Jilotepeque.  She is 47 years old, a widow, and a mother to three daughters. For more than 11 years Zoila has been making a living doing embroidery and knitting typical products.  With this work, she has earned an income to support her family.  She has a secondary job raising chickens.  Zoila's dream is to help her daughters get ahead and to provide them with an education.  This is Zoila's second Kiva loan.  She was very punctual with her repayments on the first loan and during the first year she was only late once, by three days.  Zoila thanks Fape and Kiva for the support being provided.  She is applying for this loan to buy material and threads, and to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: ti buy basic materials for making typical, knitted items.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz en el año 2000 en su condición de separada y madre de 2 hijos pequeños, hoy en las edades de 17 a 15 años, debió asumir sola su roll de generadora de ingresos, para lograr el bienestar de su familia; por eso empezó vendiendo pasabocas fritos, los cuales le produjeron su propia posibilidad de tener dinero para sostener sus hijos. En la medida en que sus hijos crecieron ella necesitaba resolver mas necesidades básicas y con esta sola tarea no alcanzaba a lograrlo. Por eso se fue a las colmenas (pequeños puntos de venta) del centro de la ciudad y empezó a trabajar en una de ellas como vendedora. Con esta experiencia en el mercado, dos años después decidió independizarse con un dinero, una parte ahorrada y la otra producto de un préstamo de alto costo, que invirtió en la compra de calzado, dándose a conocer en su clientela y entre sus proveedores, que empezaron a facilitarle crédito; cuando se estabilizó un poco, logró reunir dinero y alquiló una colmena, donde vendió mucha mercancía económica durante un periodo de tiempo, hasta que se organizó con su cónyuge y este compró vitrinas para que trabajara cerca a sus hijos, que ya eran 3 y necesitaban de su atención cercana y aunque al principio atendía los dos negocios, al final se decidió por el que estaba ubicado en su casa. Así nació su hoy miscelánea, ubicada en su residencia, donde vende de todo un poco y allí ha construido una clientela con la cual se encuentra posicionada. En la actualidad su meta es ampliar su negocio, teniendo un stock de mercancía de mucha rotación, para más adelante lograr el máximo aprovechamiento de su infraestructura, ofreciendo servicios de impresión. Ella poco a poco está dando pasos importantes y por eso se cuando se acercó por primera vez  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, compró  mercancia como calzado, ropa, cosméticos al por mayor, de contado y sobre pedido. Luz en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará mercancia sobre pedidos al pormayor y de contado, como ropa, calzado accesorios, cosméticos etc. Ella dice a sus finaciadores que está muy agradcida con los créditos, por que es un apoyo que le ha facilitado el mejoramiento de sus ingresos familiares y guarda la esperanza de un futuro mejor. Con su credikiva planea incrementar sus ventas, sus utilidades pues tiene una clientela fija que en temporadas altamente comerciales, como el segundo semestre del año, hacen que su inversión sea muy exitosa.
texts.en:
In the year 2000 Luz was separated and the mother of two small children (who are now 17- and 15-years old respectively).  She had to assume the roll of wage earner for the well-being of her family.  She started selling fried snacks, which gave her the opportunity to earn money to support her children.  As her children grew, Luz had even more expenses to cover, and she couldn't do it just selling snacks.  She went to the "colmenas" (small sales stalls) downtown and got a job working in one of them.  Two years later, with the experience she gained at the market, some saved money and some money borrowed at a high interest rate, Luz decided to go out on her own.  She invested in the purchase of footwear and made herself known to her customers and to her suppliers, who started providing her with credit.  When her business became a bit more established, Luz was able to put together some money and rent a "colmena" where she sold a lot of low-cost merchandise for a time.  Once she got organized with her husband, he purchased display cases so she could work near her children, who then numbered three and needed her closer by.  Although she at first worked at both businesses, in the end Luz decided to stick with the one set up in her home.  And that is how the corner shop she has today was born.  
The shop is located in her home, and she sells a little of everything.  Luz has built up a clientele, with which she is well-positioned.  Luz's current goal is to expand her business.  Her stock rotates quickly, and in future she wants to take full advantage of her infrastructure by offering a printing service.
Little by little, Luz is taking important steps.  When she approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the first time, she purchased wholesale, overstock and cash merchandise such as footwear, clothing and cosmetics.  Luz is currently requesting a "credikiva," with which she will purchase wholesale, overstock and cash merchandise like clothing, footwear, accessories, cosmetics etc.  She wants her financial backers to know that she is very happy with the loans.  The support has made it easier for her to improve her family's income, and she holds hope for a better future.  With her "credikiva," Luz plans to increase her sales and her profits, as she has a fixed clientele that in increased shopping times, like the second half of the year, make her investments very successful.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale, overstock and cash merchandise like clothing, shoes, accessories, cosmetics etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 28 years old from Nyahururu; she is married to Robert who is a farmer and they have two children aged 7 and 2 years old.

She is a tailor, a business she has been operating for the last four years. She has applied for her fourth loan of KES 40,000 from Kadet, Ltd. to enable her to buy stock of fabric, zippers, buttons, lace, and sewing thread to make more clothes for her customers.

She has a monthly income of KES. 18,000 right now. Her plan is to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business for building a house on a plot that she owns. She is looking forward to opening a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sundries in bulk so that she can make more clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Flor Alba

texts.es: Flor, a sus 44 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos. Debido a la falta de oportunidades de empleo, ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio para generar recursos que le permitieran aportar a la economía del hogar, por ello, desde hace 8 años se montó un taller de confecciones en un espacio de la casa donde vive, allí ofrece el servicio a terceros y adicionalmente creó su línea propia de ropa interior y deportiva, con esto ha logrado apoyar a su esposo con el mantenimiento del hogar. La cliente es una mujer activa, emprendedora, lucha incansablemente para lograr los objetivos que se propone, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos y dificultades económicas debido a que le es difícil recuperar la cartera de sus clientes, por lo que algunas veces no posee el capital de trabajo suficiente para comprar insumos, sin embargo, ha sabido salir adelante siempre motivada por su familia. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones. Accesorios, elásticos) con lo que podrá tener materia prima disponible para cumplir con todos los pedidos de sus clientes y entregarlos de manera oportuna, esto le dará la oportunidad de tener más contratos, aumentando así su producción, las ventas e ingresos que recibe por la prestación de su servicio. Flor sueña con acreditar y fortalecer su negocio, consolidarlo y ser reconocida en el sector por su buen trabajo y dedicación, con lo que tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Flor, at 44 years old, is married and the mother of two children. Because of the lack of job opportunities, she decided to start her own business to generate resources that would allow her to contribute to her household finances. So, eight years ago, she set up a sewing workshop in a space within the house she lives in. There, she offers services to procurers, and she also created her own line of underwear and activewear. With this business, she has been able to help her husband with household expenses. 

This client is an active, enterprising woman who strives tirelessly to achieve the goals she sets for herself, overcoming various obstacles and the economic difficulties associated with the fact that it is hard to collect payment from her customers; sometimes, she doesn't have the working capital to invest in the purchase of supplies. However, she has figured out how to keep going, always motivated by her family. 

Currently, Flor is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies at wholesale (fabrics, thread, buttons, accessories, and elastic) with which she will have the raw materials available to fulfill all her customer orders and deliver them in a timely fashion. This will give her the opportunity to get more contracts, thereby increasing her production, her sales, and the income she receives for the service she provides. 

Flor dreams of strengthening, fortifying, and consolidating her business, and of being recognized in the industry for her good work and dedication; this would give her the opportunity to improve her family's living conditions and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale (fabrics, thread, buttons, accessories, and elastic).

loans.name: José Dernelio

texts.es:
José de 50 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado de escolaridad, es casado, padre de cinco hijos (31, 30, 28, 24 y 17 años), la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos; dos de sus hijos viven con él y  están en la escuela .

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia 11 años de edad, él se iba a trabajar con un tío quien le enseño el trabajo para que en el futuro, pudiera sostener su hogar. La distancia que  viaja para su trabajo son de 20 minutos, se va a pie, solamente él trabaja;  ya que los hijos estudian.  Trabaja de las 6 de la mañana a las 12 del mediodía y en ocasiones va a jornadas de la tarde para que le abunde el trabajo.

El cliente con el préstamo que Fundación Campo le dará, comprara 5 sacos de abono para que la milpa le de buenos resultados. Tiene  7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo.
Los sueños de don José son tener una buena cosecha y mejores ganancias en los cultivos y poder preparar a sus hijos en la escuela, ya que él no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar que los hijos si puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
José, who is 50-years old, never had any schooling.  He is married and the father of five children (31, 30, 28, 24 and 17 years old, respectively).  His wife is a home-maker.  Two of his children live with him and go to school. 

José has made his living in agriculture since he was 11-years old.  He went to work with an uncle who taught him the trade so that in the future, he would be able to support his household.  José travels about 20 minutes on foot to work.  He works by himself, as his children are in school.  He works from 6:00 in the morning until 12:00pm, and at times he goes to meetings in the afternoon to get more work. 

With the loan that Fundación Campo will give him, José will purchase five sacks of compost so that his cornfields give a good harvest.  He has 7,000 square meters of crops. 

José's dreams are to have a good harvest and improved profits from his crop.  He also wants to be able to send his children to school.  He didn't have the chance to go to school, but his children can have careers.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of compost so that his cornfields give a good harvest.  He has 7,000 square meters of crops.

loans.name: Andres Erasmo

texts.es: Don Andrés, tiene 57 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, vive con su esposa en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Por mucho tiempo se dedico a realizar trabajos agrícolas y por necesidad de obtener más ingresos para el hogar, decidió establecer una pulpería en este negocio vende granos básicos, huevos, lácteos, harina, papel higiénico, condimentos, productos enlatados, pastas, refrescos, etc. el negocio tiene cuatro años de funcionar y cuenta con buena clientela. ha solicitado el segundo ciclo de préstamo el cual es por 15,000 Lempiras con este va surtir más el negocio de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, carnes, productos de limpieza y otros, con el fin de aumentar las ventas. Su meta es seguir creciendo para ayudar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en: Andrés is 57 years old, married and has two adult children.  He lives with his wife in the town of Azacualpa, in Santa Bárbara.  Andrés, for a long time, made a living doing farming work but, because he needed to earn a higher income to support his household, he decided to start a grocery store.  There he sells basic grains, eggs, dairy products, flour, toilet roll, condiments, tinned goods, pastas, drinks, and more.  The business has been going for four years and he has good customers.  Andrés is applying for the second loan cycle, for 15,000 Lempira.  With this loan he will stock up his business with food products such as basic grains, and meats, plus cleaning and other products, so as to increase his sales.  Andrés' goal is to continue growing in order to help his family financially.

loans.use: to buy food products such as basic grains, and meats, plus cleaning and other products.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is 39 years old, married to Anthony, and they have been blessed with five children of ages 15, 13,14, 4, and 2 years respectively. She does soap manufacturing and she has been in this business for three years and right now her monthly income is KES 6,000. She is borrowing a loan of 40,000 which she intends to increase stock of soap chemicals to her business. This is her 2nd loan and she successfully paid her previous loan. Her hope and dream is to grow in her soap business and make soap in bulk thus expand her business and open more branches.

loans.use: To increase the stock of soap chemicals

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es: Genaro vive en la comunidad de Kucya en el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo, él tiene 33 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la agricultura, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Los tigres” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Genaro lives in the community of Kucya, Colquepata District, Paucartambo Province.  He is 33-years old, married and has three children.  Genaro is a hard-working and enterprising person who gets his family ahead through hard work.  His main source of income is agriculture.  Because he is a responsible person, Genaro was invited to join the communal bank called "Los Tigres” (The Tigers).  At this time, Genaro needs the loan to purchase seeds and compost.  He is grateful for and appreciates the loan.  He promises to responsibly comply with his monthly re-payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Jesusa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.  Jesusa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy material like wood, bamboo, etc for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Jesusa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy material like wood, bamboo, etc for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Alcira Isabel

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Alcira en la venta de almuerzos y en su negocio de alquiler de lavadoras, pues con su credikiva pudo comprar arroz por bultos, aceite en pimpina y 2 lavadoras mas, para alquilar. Hoy obtiene nuevos ingresos adicionales, arrendando las máquinas para lavar, que le permiten economicamente tener una mayor solvencia.  Su negocio se ve mejor arregalado en los espacios locativos y ahora ayuda mas a su esposo con este  nuevo negocio. Alcira dice a sus finaciadores: "Gracias por darnos la oportunidad de apoyarnos en el negocio, que nos da la oportunidad de laborar diariamente." En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará mas lavadoras y comestibles por bultos para vender almuerzos. Con estas dos inversiones muy seguramente impactará a su clientela y eso es justamente el exito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Alcira in selling lunches and in her business of renting washing machines. With her Kiva loan she was able to purchase rice in bulk, oil and two more washing machines to rent. Today she is obtaining additional earnings by renting the washing machines which enable her to have greater solvency. Her business is better established in different locations and now she is better able to help her husband with this new business.

Alcira says to her funders: “Thank you for giving us the opportunity by supporting us in the business, which gives us the chance to work every day.” Currently she is applying for a new Kiva loan with which she will purchase more washing machines and food supplies in bulk for her lunch sales. These two investments will very likely impact her customers and that is exactly the success of her investment.

loans.use: to purchase more washing machines and food supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Oktay

texts.en:
Oktay, 45, is married and lives with his wife and two children, ages 17 & 20. 

For about 18 years Oktay has run his own business. He is a travelling salesman with his own car and travels around his area selling tomatoes, carrots, potatoes, onions, cucumbers, and seasonal fruits. He also works with livestock for domestic needs such as meat, milk, and milk products.

The loan that he has requested is for 1500 AZN to buy apples from Guba to sell. He needs to stock to grow his sales and increase his income. 

His goal is to grow his business and see his children graduate and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase apples to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits such as bananas and oranges, and vegetables that her customers are looking for, as well as corn so she can increase her tortilla sales.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 55 years old and married to Ann. They have been blessed with three children, ages 25, 22 and 13. 

George is a dairy farmer and he has rental houses. He has been in business for four years. Right now his monthly income is KES 6,500. He is borrowing KES 30,000 to purchase a calf. 

He plans to diversify with poultry keeping with the anticipated profit from his business. This is his first loan and his hopes and dreams are to be a commercial livestock farmer.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Rona Jean

texts.en:
Rona Jean is 39 years old and is married with 2 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rona Jean is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rona Jean has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 40 year-old married woman and mother of 3 children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She works as a tailor and has been in this line of work for ten years now. She is proud to be a great contributor to her household income. When Riffat was not earning money, her family was going through a financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner as her husband was the sole bread earner in the family. 

Her hard work has helped her to establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty fulfilling large orders. For this reason, she has requested a loan to purchase a new stitching machine and some spools of threads in different colors. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.
Riffat says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a stitching machine, laces, and spools of threads in different colors

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 46 years old and is married to Jane. They are blessed with four children aged between 17 and 11 years. 

Joshua runs butcher shop and also sells green tea leaves and milk as an additional source of income. The business has been in operation for the last 10 years generating a monthly income of KES 60,000. He will use the KES 95,000 loan to purchase a motorbike for transportation.This will diversify his business and even add to his income. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and the remaining amount to repay his loan.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a hard-working married wife and a mother of two young children. She is a maize farmer in Naituyapaki area of Narok county, Kenya, for the past 10 years earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is servicing her 3rd loan of KES 70,000 from KADET. This will assist her to purchase farm inputs and seedlings for this planting season.

Esther plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in order to boost her farm harvest. Her future dreams is to prosper in her business even as her children get established through education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Nchakunini

texts.en:
Nchakinini is 67 years old, married to Siteni, and supports a family of ten. For the last 30 years, he has farmed his own piece of land for income. He has been cultivating potatoes that seem to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions.

He learned about KADET LTD through other farmers. This will be his 5th loan. He plans to buy farm inputs including fertilizers, pesticides and manure for the potato farm.  With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this produce, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of potatoes.

His dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more potatoes for commercial use, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children. He is a hard-working man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, 28 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost one year.

In this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 300 a day. Due to insufficient funds she has asked for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase sugar, cooking oil, coffee, canned goods, detergent soaps, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking oil, coffee, canned goods, detergent soaps, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel vive en la comunidad de Kucya en el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo, él tiene 23 años de edad y es soltero, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces sus actividades económicas son la elaboración de artesanía, la ganadería,  la agricultura y brindar servicio de transportes, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Los tigres” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca y oveja, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Fidel lives in the village of Kucya in the district of Colquepata in the province of Paucartambo. He is 23 years old and unmarried. He is hardworking and motivated and works to support his family. He makes a living by making crafts, raising livestock, farming, and offering transport services. Because he is a responsible person, he was invited to join the Los Tigres village bank. He is requesting a loan at this time to buy alpaca and sheep's wool. He is grateful and appreciates the loan and is committed to making his monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy alpaca and sheep's wool.

loans.name: Tabita Manassette Group

texts.es: Rubén, quien aparece en silla de ruedas en la fotografía, pertenece al Banco Comunal Tabita Manassette, Banco que se encuentra establecido en Villarrica, IX Región de la Araucanía en Chile. En este Banco Comunal existen distintos rubros, entre los cuales destacan venta de verdura, ropa nueva y usada, venta de confites, soldaduras y confección de ropa. Rubén vende maní, es publicista, pero nunca pudo encontrar trabajo en su profesión y se le ocurrió esta gran idea de vender maní, empezó hace tres años y con un capital de $12.000 pesos, y al día tiene 3 carritos, lo que lo llena de orgullo y felicidad ya que además puede darle trabajo a otras personas. Ha debido afrontar la falta de dinero como un gran problema, aunque se ha preocupado siempre de hacer buen marketing, tiene gorros y poleras con la marca de sus carritos. El dinero que está solicitando es para comprar mercadería y además arreglos que necesita uno de sus carros. Espero con ansias que este ciclo le vaya muy bien. Nos cuenta que le agrada mucho trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza, por el hecho de que no solicitan tantos documentos.
texts.en: Rubén, who's shown in the photograph in the wheelchair, belongs to the communal bank "Tabita Manassette," which is located in Villaricca in the Araucanía Region of Chile. There are a lot of different lines of work in this communal bank; some which stand out are vegetable selling, new and used clothing selling, candy selling, welding, and dressmaking. Rubén sells peanuts; he is an advertiser, but he never managed to find work in his profession, and the thought of selling peanuts occurred to him as a great idea. He began three years ago with a fund of $12,000 pesos; today he now has three food carts, which fills him with pride and happiness because he also is able to provide employment for other people. He had to confront the lack of money as a large problem; however, he always has thought about marketing well. He has hats and t-shirts that bear the mark of his food carts. The money that he is applying for is to buy goods and also to make repairs to one of his carts. He looks forward to this loan cycle going very well for him. He tells us that he likes to work with Fondo Esperanza very much because of the fact that they don't request so much paperwork.

loans.use: to buy goods and make improvements to his food cart.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Alegres  está en su ciclo número 4º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una de las integrantes, y conforme a ello poder centrarse en el trabajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Fabiola, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, y comenta que es muy buena en lo que hace y que le va bien, que tiene buena venta. Ella se considera una mujer trabajadora que lucha por mejorar y por ayudar a su familia. Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para pode seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos y demás.
Fabiola agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda y podrá seguir invirtiendo en su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres Alegres” (Cheerful Women) is in its fourth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program.  All of the members work and help one another get ahead.  They have taken a poverty elimination survey so that they can become familiar with each of their situations.  This also helps them to become stable in their work.  

One of the members is Sra. Fabiola, who sells food.  She says that she is very good at what she does and is doing well as indicated by her good sales.  Fabiola considers herself to be a hardworking woman who strives to improve and provide help to her family.  Today she is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of supplies for preparing the dishes that she sells.  These items include meat, vegetables, condiments, and other products.  

Fabiola is grateful for the opportunity she has received since it will be of great help and allow her to continue investing in her business plans.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Don Víctor  de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa  y sus dos hijos quienes trabajan y le ayudan en los gastos del hogar, él tiene un taller de sastrería desde hace 7 años en su lugar de residencia, es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y honesta, tiene mucha clientela por su buen trabajo y buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Victor está solicitando un crédito  para la compra de hilos, agujas, botones, telas, etc. para seguir con su trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancia para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Fifty-eight-year-old Victor lives in his own home with his wife and his two children who work and help him with the household expenses.  He has had a tailor's shop in his home for seven years.  He is a very responsible, hardworking, and honest person.  He has a big clientele because his work and prices are good.  He is able to cover some of the household expenses with what he earns.  Victor is asking for a loan to buy thread, needles, buttons, fabric, etc. so he can keep working and earn more to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, buttons, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Oscar De Jesús

texts.es: Oscar, con 65 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, un montallantas que inició con el ideal de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, se encuentra ubicado en un pequeño local cerca a su lugar de residencia; allí ofrece el servicio desde las 6:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm, aprovechando la ventaja de que el local ya es reconocido porque anteriormente allí funcionaba un negocio del mismo tipo. Oscar aprendió esta labor gracias a su experiencia como conductor de vehículos, pues se veía obligado a realizar labores de mecánica y cambio de llantas. El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (llantas, neumáticos, parches, entre otros) con lo que podrá seguir con su labor y prestar un servicio de manera más ágil y eficiente, esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de su clientela y de los ingresos que recibe por la prestación del servicio. Oscar desea seguir avanzando y fortalecer aún más su negocio para que le permita disfrutar de una estabilidad económica y le dé la oportunidad de adquirir una casa propia para disfrutar los frutos de su ardua labor en compañía de su esposa.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 65, works in his own business.  He started his tire installation shop with the intent of improving his living conditions.  His business is located in a small shop located near his home.  There he offers his services from 6:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M.  He takes advantage of the fact that his shop has recognition since a similar business was located there previously.  

Oscar learned this line of work thanks to his experience driving these types of vehicles.  This forced him to learn about mechanical repairs and how to change tires.  The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of wholesale supplies such as rims, tires, patches, and other items.  This will allow him to continue his work so that he can provide his services more easily and efficiently.  As a result, Oscar will be able to increase his clientele and the income he receives for providing this service.  

Oscar wants to continue advancing and strengthening his business so that he can enjoy financial stability.  This will give him the opportunity to acquire a house of his own so that he can enjoy the fruits of his hard labor along with his wife.

loans.use: to buy rims, tires, patches, and other items.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro vive en la comunidad de Kucya en el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo, él tiene 25 años de edad y tiene una relación unión libre, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces sus actividades económicas son la elaboración de tejidos, la ganadería y la agricultura, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Los tigres” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana de alpaca y oveja, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Isidro lives in the community of Kucya in the Colquepata District of Paucartambo Province.  He is 25 years old and he is in a relationship.  He is a hardworking and enterprising person who gets his family ahead through his hard work.  He works in weaving, ranching, and farming.  He is a responsible person, which is why he was invited to participate in the Los Tigres Communal Bank, and he currently needs a loan to buy work materials, such as alpaca and sheep wool.  He is thankful for and appreciates his loan and he promises to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy work materials, such as alpaca and sheep wool

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Don Luis  vive con  su esposa y sus tres hijos, el mayor de ellos trabaja y ayuda en los gastos del hogar, los otros dos estudian actualmente, don luis se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y francés lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora por ello  siempre va viendo todo lo mejor para  su familia  y es ese el motivo del que él está solicitando un crédito  para realizar la compra de  mas pan dulce y  francés por mayor para seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así generar más ingresos  y tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en: Luis lives with his wife and three children. The eldest works and helps with the household expenses while the others are currently in school.  Luis sells sweet bread and French bread for a living.  He sells door-to-door in the different neighborhoods close to his home.  He is a very responsible and hardworking person, which is why he is always looking for the best for his family.  This is why he is asking for a loan; to buy more sweet bread and French bread wholesale so he can keep working, as this is his only source of work, and thereby generate more income and have a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy more sweet bread and French bread wholesale

loans.name: Irma Flor

texts.es: Doña Irma de 64 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en casa alquilada con su compañero de vida y su hija, hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de licuados, y refrescos  con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Irma solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio de licuados como: leche, fresas, guineos (bananos), chocolate, etc.  con esto espera obtener mejores ganancias y  brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Irma is 64 years old.  She is a very hardworking and responsible person.  She lives in a rented home with her life partner and their daughter.  Twelve years ago she started selling smoothies and soft drinks.  With the earnings from her business she is able to cover some of her household expenses.  Irma is asking for a loan to buy supplies for her smoothie business, such as milk, strawberries, bananas, chocolate, etc.  She hopes this will bring in better earnings and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy milk, strawberries, bananas, chocolate, etc.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es: Fermin vive en la comunidad de Kucya en el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo, él tiene 68 años de edad y es casado, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces sus actividades económicas son la elaboración de tejidos, la ganadería y la agricultura, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Los tigres” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Fermin lives in the community of Kucya in the Colquepata District of Paucartambo Province.  He is 68 years old and married.  He is a hardworking and enterprising person who gets his family ahead through his hard work.  He works in weaving, ranching, and farming for a living.  He is a responsible person, which is why he was invited to participate in the Los Tigres Communal Bank, and he currently needs a loan to buy fertilizers.  He is thankful for and appreciates his loan and he promises to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Francisco Adolfo

texts.es: Don Francisco es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 4 hijos quienes estudian actualmente, hace varios años se dedica  a la siembra de maíz y frijol cuando su cosecha esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Francisco solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is a very hardworking, responsible, and honest person. He lives in his own house with his wife and their 4 children, who are currently in school. 

For several years, he has worked growing corn and beans. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries that are shown in the photo. With what he obtains from his business, he is able to pay his household expenses. 

Francisco is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies for planting: compost, seeds, fertilizers, weed-killers, etc. With it, he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase compost, seeds, fertilizer, weed-killers, etc.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis vive en la comunidad de Kucya en el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo, él tiene 38 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene seis hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces sus actividades económicas son la elaboración de tejidos, la ganadería y la agricultura, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Los tigres” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como lana de alpaca y oveja, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Luis lives in the community of Kucya in the Colquepata District of Paucartambo Province.  He is 38 years old and married and his marriage has produced six children.  He is a hardworking and enterprising person who gets his family ahead through his hard work.  He works in knitting, ranching, and farming for a living.  He is a responsible person, which is why he was invited to participate in the Los Tigres Communal Bank, and he currently needs a loan to buy work materials, such as alpaca and sheep wool.  He is thankful for and appreciates his loan and he promises to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy work materials, such as alpaca and sheep wool

loans.name: Carla

texts.es: Carla, de 22 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a ellos y su hermana. El trabajo de Carla consiste en la venta de ropa de distintas marcas en diferentes tallas, colores y modelos para damas caballeros y niños, ella se encarga personalmente de comprar las prendas al por mayor y de seleccionarlas una a una pensando siempre en lo que más le gusta a su público y en la comodidad que sienten ellos al usar las prendas que vende. Trabaja con ayuda de su mamá. Lleva en este trabajo ya 3 años, lo realiza en su casa o visitando algunas viviendas, ha logrado tener una lista de clientes fijos entre amigos y familiares, algunas veces vende a crédito y otras veces al contado y por ello recibe buenas ganancias económicas que le ayudan a mantener su solvencia económica. Le gusta mucho lo que hace pues tiene libertad para manejar su tiempo y organizarse de acuerdo a la disponibilidad de sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, se siente contenta de saber que le brindan el acceso a una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará gran cantidad de prendas de vestir conformada por polos, blusas y pantalones que son del agrado de su clientela.
texts.en:
Carla is 22 years old, single, and has no children.  She lives at home with her parents and her sister.  Carla’s work consists of selling brand-name clothing for women, men, and children.  These items come in different sizes, colors, and styles.  She is personally responsible for buying the clothes at wholesale and selecting them based on what she thinks her customers will like.  Carla also considers how comfortable the clothes are when they are worn.  

Carla works with her mother.  She has been in this line of work for three years.  Carla conducts her business at her house or by visiting some of her customers at their homes.  She has an established clientele that includes friends and relatives.  Sometimes she extends credit and there are other times when she accepts cash.  She generates a good income, which helps her remain financially solvent.  Carla enjoys what she does because it gives her the freedom to manage her time and organize how she avails herself to her customers.  

She is taking this opportunity to request 2,000 PEN.  Carla is pleased to know that she can access a line of credit to advance her business.  For this reason, she promises to be responsible with her loan payments.  The amount she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of comfortable clothes such as pullover shirts, blouses, and trousers that her customers will like.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing that she can sell.

loans.name: Cañada Poty Group

texts.es:
Cañada Poty está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ellas está poniendo de si para poder salir adelante.  Y a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ellas se encuentran mejorando su situación.
Una de ellas es Edith, quien es una excelente peluquera, conocida en el barrio, y comenta que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está logrando salir adelante y dar a su familia lo que necesitan. Ella es una persona luchadora y muy trabajara, que esta capacitándose y tratando de ser una mejor profesional. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Cañada Poty” is a group that is in its third loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program.  Each member is willing to do what it takes to get ahead.  Through their efforts and their continuous work, they have been able to practice the vital behaviors of what it takes to become a successful woman.  They are improving each of their situations.  

One of these women is Edith, who manages a successful beauty salon that is known in her neighborhood.  She says that she has made many sacrifices and has strived to become successful so that she can provide her family with what they need.  Edith is a determined and hardworking person who is learning and trying to be a better professional.  She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of dyes, shampoo, rinses, crèmes, and other supplies that will enable her to continue working and providing good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, rinses, crèmes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anderson Lenis

texts.es: Anderson con 33 años de edad, es soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Desde muy joven comenzó a asistir a ensayos de diferentes grupos musicales y en ellos se dio cuenta del talento que posee para la música. Poco tiempo después fue contratado para dar clases en diferentes municipios y por cuenta propia ofrecía clases particulares con lo que se generaba los ingresos para su sustento, con unos ahorros compró un juego de sonido el cual alquilaba para diferentes eventos y así complementaba la entrada de dinero con el cual solventa sus necesidades básicas. Con la experiencia y el conocimiento que posee en este campo de acción, se convirtió en canta autor y, hace poco tiempo, con el ideal de estabilizar su economía, decidió iniciar su propia escuela de música, allí ofrece clases de canto, guitarra, percusión y piano, adicionalmente alquila un espacio a diferentes grupos para los ensayos. Anderson es un hombre pujante, activo y con un espíritu emprendedor que lo ha llevado a progresar poco a poco, lucha incansablemente por cumplir el sueño de que su escuela de música se convierta en una de las mejores y que sea reconocida, pero es consciente que para lograrlo debe trabajar arduamente, con dedicación y mucho empeño. Esto lo motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, que será invertido en la compra de instrumentos musicales (guitarras, piano, juego de percusión, xilófonos y flautas dulces) con lo que ampliará su capacidad instalada y tendrá la posibilidad de tener más estudiantes, lo que afectará directa y positivamente sus finanzas, pues tendrá mejores ingresos. De esta forma podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Anderson is 33 years old, single, and has no children.  At a very young age, he began attending rehearsals for various musical groups and discovered that he had a talent for music.  Shortly thereafter, he was hired to teach classes in different towns and also began giving private lessons on his own so that he could generate income to support himself.  With some of his savings, he bought a sound system that he rents out for different events.  This provides additional income so that he can meet his basic needs.  

As a result of his experience and knowledge in this field, Anderson has now become a singer-songwriter.  Within a short time, he also decided to start a music school so that he could become financially stable.  He offers classes in voice, guitar, percussion, and piano.  In addition, he rents out a space that different groups can use for their rehearsals.  

Anderson is a vigorous and active man who possesses an enterprising spirit, which has enabled him to make gradual progress.  He strives tirelessly to fulfill his dream of seeing his music school become one of the best and among the most recognized.  However, he is aware that he must work hard, with dedication, and with great effort.  This has motivated him to request the help of loan, which he will invest in the purchase of musical instruments (guitars, a piano, a percussion set, xylophones, and recorders).  This will expand his capacity so that he can accommodate more students, which will have a positive and direct effect on his finances since he will have more income.  In addition, he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy guitars, a piano, a percussion set, xylophones, and recorders for his music school.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Don Oscar es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa en el sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una pulpería.
Don Oscar tiene su negocio desde hace más de 8 años. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de refrescos, galletas, churros, café, pan, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, huevos, etc. y así tener más mercadería para poder satisfacer mejor a sus clientes. 
Don Oscar con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer espera cubrir las necesidades que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 
Don Oscar en unos años espera que su negocio siga creciendo y se convierta en una tienda más grande y reconocida de la zona y que sus hijos se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la sociedad.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Don Oscar is a responsible, hardworking and honest person.  He lives with his wife and three children in southern Honduras.  His business is a grocery store.  

Don Oscar has been in business for more than eight years.  He needs a loan in order to buy soft drinks, cookies, fried dough snacks, coffee, bread, beans, rice, sugar, lard, eggs, and other products.  By having more merchandise, he will be better able to satisfy his customers.  Don Oscar hopes that the loan will increase the sales in his business since he will have more products to offer.  He also hopes to cover his family’s needs and gradually improve their quality of life.  

With a few years, Don Oscar hopes to keep growing his business so that his store becomes much larger and well-known in the area.  He also wants his children to become good people and hopes that society will offer them better opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cookies, fried dough snacks, coffee, bread, beans, rice, sugar, lard, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Kinaru

texts.en:
Kinaru is 31 years old, married to Nasuru and supports a family of five. He practices wheat farming in the Nkareta area of Narok county, Kenya. He has done this for the last year, earning a monthly income of KES 17,000. Kinaru learnt about KADET Ltd from other farmers in the area, who are registered and are already being funded by KADET ltd.

With a first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET, he plans to use the funds to prepare his land for farming and purchase more farm inputs like fertilizers, insecticides and seeds. The anticipated profits will be reinvested into his farm and will help pay for his family’s basic needs.

Kinaru's dream is to increase his financial status.

loans.use: to prepare his land for farming as well purchase more farm inputs.

loans.name: Topister

texts.en:
Topister is 24 years old from Nakuru. She is married to Dennis who is a businessman and together they are blessed with two children aged 9 and 4 years old who are currently in school.

Topister has a beauty salon that she has been operating for the past three years. She has applied for a loan to enable her to stock her salon with hair chemicals, oils, and hair additions like weaves and braids.This is her third loan of KES 70,000 from KADET ltd.

Currently, Topister earns a monthly income of KES 30,000 and she plans to use the anticipated income from her expanded business to pay back her loan as well as to educate her children.

Topister's hopes and dreams lie in starting a hairdressing school to empower other ladies with a talent for hairdressing. Topister also desires to see her family become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals, oil and hair additions like weaves and braids.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 44-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan for her son’s fruit-selling business. Her husband has been selling fruits and her son is also involved with his father's activity; both equally participate in household expenses. Her son has grown and got a lot of experience in the fruit-selling business. Now he knows fruit market rates, wholesalers and how to tackle customers, so he wants to establish a new fruit shop near his house, so that he could earn money and could look after the house as well.

Therefore, Zahida requested a loan from kiva’s field partner so that her son could buy fresh inventory for his new shop.

She wants to save profits so that she can arrange a marriage of her son.

Zahida hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon.

Zahida is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits for a newly-opened shop.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en: Muna was born in 1988. She is married and has one son. Her husband is a houseware trader. Muna has been working with her husband in selling houseware for the last year. This project was a good support for them to cover their son’s needs. She is seeking a youth loan to buy a larger quantity of houseware to sell in order to raise her profit and income. Because Muna is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more houseware to trade.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, May works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from retail charcoal and manicure and pedicures. May is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to pay for rice grains.

May has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for rice grains.

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
San Lorenzo está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza y están trabajando para poder ir mejorando.
Celsa es miembro de este grupo, y comenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma elabora. Tiene muy buena clientela y cada vez va mejorando más y mas, con lo cual puede ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras, jamón, queso y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas. Está contenta por formar el comité, que le será de mucha ayuda para seguir mejorando su vida e ingresos.
texts.en:
“San Lorenzo” is a group that is in its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program.  All of the members work and help one another get ahead.  They have taken the poverty elimination survey and are working toward improvement.  

Celsa is a member of this group.  She says that she sells food that she prepares herself.  Celsa has a good clientele that is increasing more and more each time.  This enables her to help her family.  She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of meat, condiments, vegetables, ham, cheese, and other supplies in order that she can continue preparing her dishes.  Celsa is pleased to have joined the committee, since it will be of great help in improving her life and her income.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, ham, cheese, and other supplies.

loans.name: Safi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha est conseillère d’une association d’affaire  « Safi»,  jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 35 ans  et mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est vendeuse de Maïs.  Elle installe  dans un dépôt agricole (grenier). Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, il y a plus de 5 ans.  La cliente a déjà réalisé beaucoup de micro projets pour sa famille à travers les bénéfices de ce commerce. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 40 sacs de maïs. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise,  exécuter un projet d’élevage moderne,  scolariser ses enfants et construire une jolie maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente tiens son enfant par terre.
texts.en:
The member Furaha is an advisor to the "Safi" business association. She is a young experienced entrepreneur, 35 years of age and mother of seven children, all studying.

The group member sells corn. She sets up her shop in an agricultural depot (granary). She started her business with her own funds received from her husband,  more than 5 years ago. The group member has already achieved many micro-projects for her family thanks to this business activity.

This new loan will be used to buy 40 bags of corn. She intends to expand her business, start a modern livestock project, educate her children and build a nice house.

Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for its micro-credit support to small non-bankable entrepreneurs. It should be noted that one of the group members has her child sitting on the ground.

loans.use: buy 40 bags of corn

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita, de 69 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Pedro y sus 2 nietos en su casa propia. Desde muy joven aprendió todo lo necesario del campo, como producirlo y sacarlo adelante. Gracias a sus padres, obtuvo los terrenos agrícolas que le ayudó a sacar adelante a sus 7 hijos, los cuales se encuentran saludables e independientes, “cada uno con su familia”, menciona. Ella es una mujer extraordinaria, cuida de sus nietos, pues sus padres murieron. Por ese motivo continuo sembrando papa, maíz y alfalfa, los cuales comercializa en sus mismos terrenos agrícolas, además de poseer animales como vacas, ovejas, toros, los cuales comercializa cuando se encuentran maduros. Pero como desea brindar lo mejor a sus sobrinos, hace algunos años comenzó a vender alimentos en el cafetín de la escuela de su pueblo, donde obtiene ingresos adicionales.
Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, pues le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Felicita, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de alfalfa, que le servirán como alimento para sus animales.
texts.en:
Felicita, 69, is a humble woman. She lives together with her husband, Pedro, and her two grandchildren in a house of their own. She learned all the countryside activities needed to produce and get ahead. Thanks to her parents, she owns land that helped her raise her seven children, all healthy and independent, “each with their own families,” as she says.

She is an extraordinary woman who takes care of her grandchildren since their parents died. This is why she continued to grow potatoes, corn and alfalfa. She sells her produce at home and has besides cows, sheep and bulls, which she sells when they have reached the right conditions. Thinking of her grandchildren, she started to sell food in a local school's restaurant, receiving an additional income.

This is her second loan with KIVA. She appreciates the financial support she has received, which has helped her improve her business. This is why she promises to pay the installments on time. Felicita will invest the 500 soles [PEN] in organic fertilizers for her alfalfa plantations, used to feed her animals.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна живет и работает в городе Мелитополь. Уже около 17 лет она торгует на крупном местном рынке детской и женской одеждой. Торговое место у нее собственное. Татьяна очень трудолюбивая и ответственная.  
Татьяне понадобилась дополнительная финансовая помощь в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонный товар. Своих средств оказалось недостаточно, чтобы приобрести оптом детский и женский трикотаж и белье на продажу.
texts.en:
Tatyana lives and works in the town of Melitopol. She has been selling children's and women's clothing on the large local market for over seventeen years. She has her own vendor space. Tatyana is very hardworking and responsible.

Tatyana needs financial help in the amount of 15,000 hryvnia to buy seasonal merchandise. She does not have enough of her own means to buy children's and women's clothing and underwear in wholesale for retail.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal children's and women's clothing and underwear.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена живет в Мелитополе. Она зарабатывает на жизнь, торгуя на рынке детской обувью и одеждой. Работает в этой сфере Елена уже 14 лет. Торговое место у нее свое, благодаря чему может экономить на арендной плате.  
В этот раз Елене понадобилась сумма в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить товар к осеннему сезону, а именно приобрести платья, кофты, куртки, головные уборы и обувь под реализацию осенью. За счет кредита Елена надеется развивать свой бизнес и улучшать быт семьи.
texts.en:
Yelena lives in Melitopol. She is making a living by selling children's shoes and clothing on the market. She has been working in this field for fourteen years. She has her own vendor space thanks to which she can save on the rental costs.

This time Yelena needs an amount of 10,000 hryvnia to buy inventory for the autumn season such as dresses, sweaters, jackets, headgear and footwear for sale in the fall. Yelena hopes to grow her business and improve the livelihood of her family using the loan.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, sweaters, headgear and footwear for the autumn season.

loans.name: Sigyongyaakadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme Safiatou est la représentante du groupe SIGYONGYAAKADI. Elle se porte bien. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 03mois. Les 03 vont a l’école. Elle a 05personnes en charge.
Elle vend des pagnes  et aussi des produits de beauté depuis 06ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 15 pièces de pagnes  et des boites de pommades.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut épargner. Elle ambitionne  étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Safiatou is the Sigyongyaakadi group representative. She is doing well. She married and the mother of 4 children, the eldest of whom is 15 years old and the youngest, 3 months. Three of the children go to school. She is also responsible for 5 other people. Safiatou has been selling pages (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth) and beauty products for 6 years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market. Her customers are women and men. She would like to buy 15 bolts of pagnes and some boxes of pomade. She wants to save her profits. She aims to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 15 bolts of pagnes and some boxes of pomade.

loans.name: Dapelgo Group

texts.fr:
Mme DJENEBA représente le groupe DAPELGO. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a7ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 01 va à l’école. 
Mme vend des articles de boutique depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de toecin. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 10paquets de biscuit, 03cartons de spaguetti, 01carton de magie et 10sachets de bonbon.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices afin d’aider son mari à la scolarisation des enfants. Elle ambitionne augmenter les articles de sa boutique.
texts.en: Djeneba is the Dapelgo group representative. She is married and the mother of 2 children, the eldest of whom is 7 years old and the youngest 2. One of the children goes to school. Djeneba has been selling (food) products in a shop for 4 years. She gets her supplies at the Toecin market. Her customers are men and women. She would like to buy 1 box of biscuits, 3 boxes of spaghetti, 1 box of Maggie stock cubes and 10 packets of sweets. She wants to invest her profits in helping her husband provide their children with an education. She aims to increase the amount of products she has in her shop.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of biscuits, 3 boxes of spaghetti, 1 box of Maggie stock cubes and 10 packets of sweets.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Sabaly est un regroupement de femmes mariées du quartier  Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien. Elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles ont en moyenne 34 ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les tissus, la céréale, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe. 
Koro, 2 eme de la droite vers la gauche, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des colis de tissus. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et vend ses articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Koro espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90.000 CFA  qui sera   utilisé pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Sabaly is a group of married women who live in the Hamdallaye district of Koutiala town and who know each other well. They live in extended, traditional families and have an average age of 34 and 4 children or more. The women in this group sell various items including fabrics and cereals. The members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program in order to increase the size of their businesses. They are on their 4th group loan.

Koro, second from the right in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy some packages of fabrics. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market and sells the items for cash, door-to-door or at the market, to a divers retail clientèle. Koro hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90 000 francs which will be used for personal expenditures and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Djiguitougou est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Medina Coura qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles  et ayant en moyenne 36 ans, sont mariées et ont  4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les habits, les condiments, les boissons non alcoolisées (jus), les parfums, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt de groupe. 
Kadia  est un membre du groupe Djiguitougou debout au milieu sur la photo.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter les ingrédients pour la préparation des jus. Elle se procure de ces produits au grand marché et vend les jus au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguitougou comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 49 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Kadia  compte réaliser  65 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Djiguitougou is a group of women from the Medina Coura neighborhood who live in large traditional families. They are on average 36 years old, married with four children. This group of women sells various items such as clothes, condiments, soft drinks (juice), perfumes, etc..

To expand their business, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their fourth group loan.

Kadia is the member of the Djiguitougou group who is standing in the middle of the photo. She plans to use the loan to buy ingredients to prepare juice drinks. She gets her supplies from the general market and sells the juice for cash from home and at the market to a diverse clientele.

While other members of the Djiguitougou group expect to achieve an average profit of 49,000 CFA francs each during this loan cycle, Mrs. Kadia expects to achieve 65,000 CFA francs.

In addition to the repayment of loans, they use some of the income to meet personal expenses and increase their working capital.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make fruit juice

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María es una mujer emprendedora microempresaria de 59 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos de 17 y 9 años, su negocio es la venta de carne de res desde hace 43 años, comercializa la carne en un puesto del mercado, su hija le ayuda a despachar a los clientes. Tiene 1 año de ser cliente de la institución el crédito lo requiere para comprar la carne de res por quintal.
texts.en: María is an enterprising small business owner. She is 59 years old, married, with two children aged 17 and 9. Her business is selling beef, and she has worked at this for 43 years. She sells her meat in a stall in the market, where her daughter helps her serve her customers. She has been a client of the microfinance organisation for one year. She is seeking a loan in order to buy beef by the quintal (a 46 kg unit).

loans.use: to buy beef at wholesale.

loans.name: Sayavus

texts.en:
Sayavus is a 42-year-old married man. He has two kids. He is a market vendor and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables in his place in a central bazaar and from his home. Sayavus has 10 years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers. 

He chose this business because it is profitable and brings a stable income. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan's families and it also make fresh punch. His monthly income is 120 AZN.

He applied for a 2,000 AZN loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his monthly turnover. This will be his 3rd loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his monthly turnover.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 48 and lives with her six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mechanic by profession, he repairs and renews damaged motors and water pumps. He has been doing this business for many years. He provides his services near factories in which heavy motors are utilized for manufacturing. He mostly goes inside the factory to repair the plant's motors and sometimes he repairs them in his shop.

A few days ago he forgot his bag of tools in the factory and it was lost. Now he is unable to continue his business without the tools. He has lot of work pending to complete but he cannot fix the problem without them. He wants to buy all of his important tools to continue his services. Therefore, Shahnaz requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to provide troubleshooting services again and buy new tools.

Shahnaz says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools to repair motors and water pumps.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda was born in 1954. She is widowed and a mother of four. She lives in a rented house at a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. Ayda has been selling used clothes with her two sons for eight months. She finds this project profitable and is planning to expand it by adding new products like used bags and shoes but she doesn't have enough money to buy them. For this reason, she applied for this loan. 

Because Ayda is a conservative woman, she asked her son Hani to take her place in the picture.

loans.use: to buy bags and shoes to trade.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Don Carlos, tiene 61 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Trabajo por muchos años en la agricultura de granos básicos y hace 8 años decidió tener una Barbería donde ofrece servicios como ser corte de cabello para hombres y barba. este negocio lo tiene en su casa y ya cuenta con sus clientes. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 8,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de espejo, Gillette, gel para cabello, y maquina rasuradora. Este préstamo le ayudara a crecer el negocio para ofrecer mejor servicio al cliente. su plan es mejorar sus ingresos cada día.
texts.en:
Don Carlos, 61, is single and has two children. He lives in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. He worked in agriculture for many years, growing grains. Eight years ago, he decided to open a barber shop, where he offers haircuts and shaving. He works at home and he has a good client base.

Carlos is requesting a loan of 8,000 Lempiras [HNL] to buy a mirror, shaving cream, hair gel and a hair clipper. This loan will help him to expand his business and offer his clients a better service. His plan is to increase his income every day more.

loans.use: to buy mirrors, shaving cream, hair gel and a hair clipper to improve his service.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 23 years old and married to Julius. They have been blessed with two children, ages 7 and 1 respectively. Mary sells charcoal and has rental houses; she has been in this business for two years.

Currently, Mary earns a monthly income is KES 5,000. She is borrowing a loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to buy more charcoal for her shop. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business with the anticipated profits and sell charcoal at wholesale prices. This is her first loan. Her hope for the near future is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Santos Isaias

texts.es: Don Santos de 32 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora, vive en casa de unos familiares con su grupo familiar, hace varios años se dedica a la venta de cocos en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Santos solicita un crédito para la compra de cocos por mayor para seguir con su negocio y con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Santos is 32 years old. He is a very hardworking person. He lives in a relative's house with his family. He sells coconuts where he lives.
